Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: FynnGrace
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a quad room (it was huge w/big bathroom) and window facing the front. The staff is delightful and we enjoyed being able to step out the door and walk anywhere. Stunning sights just out your front door. Breakfast can get a little hectic as the room is quite small, cold but good. Hot cappuccinos rock. Good value for your travel dollar. Watch for fast cars on road in front of hotel (just a few steps out the door)!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, recommended for short stay”
Reviews.Author: AM
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Nerva for 2 nights. Hotel is very well located and close to the major attractions and shopping. We walked to Trevi, Spanish Steps and Via Del Corso (shopping) with our 5 yo without any problems. Colosseum is also within easy walking distance. Rooms are small and the toilets are even smaller. Be prepared for minuscule shower stalls where you cannot stretch your arms :) But everything was very clean and well maintained and since we were out most of the day it hardly mattered. Staff was very good and helpful and breakfast was fun in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marie R
Reviews.Content: My family had two rooms, and stayed last week. I am in a wheelchair, and Room 1 was big enough for me to get around. It is a small hotel, but I was able to get around fine. The staff was very nice and helpful. The only problem is the hotel is on a hill and busy cobble street. Be careful. We took a taxi must days, and it helped a lot in traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: ruckhus
Reviews.Content: The property itself is average and there is nothing remarkable about the room, which was clean and comfortable; the bathroom, which was clean and very small but location and the staff were outstanding. We stayed for three nights to attend the Rome Marathon and the staff was very helpful in maximizing our time and recommending the best sights and restaurants. The hotel couldn't be in a better position to see all the sights in downtown Rome. It is off the main street in a quiet neighborhood but the windows look out on the back wall of the Forum and everything is within walking distance. Breakfast is typical European continental and was very good and plentiful. With out a doubt, next time in Rome we will stay in the Hotel Nerva again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: italaphile
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nerva for three nights, in the annex just round the corner from the main hotel. The room (a triple) was small but had just enough space to stow our luggage, and overlooked a very quiet street, so no traffic noise. The bathroom was a nice surprise with a modern shower, spotlessly clean fixtures and attractive decor. The location is ideal, just minutes from the Forum and the Palatine museum. Breakfast is good - excellent cappuccino, croissants, cheese, ham, fruit. The staff are very friendly and helpful. They printed our boarding passes, booked tickets for the Vatican Museum, and got us a car to take us to the airport. We love the location, tucked away on a side street just minutes from the Forum. It's not a fancy hotel but the location and staff make it a very pleasant place to stay. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, friendly, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Eugene169
Reviews.Content: A warm and friendly family hotel, clean and comfortable and quiet, in a marvellous location. We recommend the breakfasts, while the bed was comfortable and the room clean. The staff were particularly helpful. Not luxurious or spacious but nonetheless a pleasure to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Alshepuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights. The hotel is on a side road behind the Roman Forum. I will start with the negatives. 1. Very small bathroom Now the positives 1. Location. Close to most places for a steady walk 2. Staff. Really helpful. Gave useful information on places to stay and eat 3. Breakfast. Although a cold breakfast it was very fresh and plentiful 4. Hard but very comfortable bed When we go back we will dfinitely be stayinghere

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: tiramisucat
Reviews.Content: You walk out and you see the roman ruins, what more to say? The Colosseum is only a 5 min walk away. Hotel facilities are basic but sufficient. Bar downstairs is reasonably priced and coffee is good (don't think it's possible to find bad coffee in Italy though :) Def would come back for the price and location!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location and very freindly people”
Reviews.Author: Danny1956
Reviews.Content: Location Location Location, its the best, Well appointed ( and small) rooms central to a host of activities and good advice. Only drawback was - as we had a wheel chair in our party, having to go up the side street and more steps to access our room. Whilst the steps were achievable ushing the wheelchair up hills all days and then the last thing is tiring.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Koncuy S
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation in Hotel Nerva for my friends from the internet and they could not stop thanking me for choosing this place. "Great location and excellent service", they said. Therefore, I wanted to share their opinions. I definitely will consider visiting Rome and staying in Hotel Nerva in near future myself...

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bhupendraa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and fell in love with it. A small property located in an old fort type of building takes your imaginations back to history of Rome. Rooms are small but well furnished and have all descent amenities of a three star budget hotel. Restaurant is small and cosy and so is the reception. Location is simply excellent and close to all the major attractions at a walking distance. You have several very good restaurents in the vicinity and walk to the hotel in itself is an experience of lifetime. The hotel perfectly blends with the historical atmosphere of Rome and you never feel out of place in spite of smallness of everything in the hotel including the lift where one can hardly fit in with a big suitcase. The reception is very friendly and helps you in planning your sightseeing and keeps maps and other useful informations. I am going to stay here again during my next visit to Rome and you must try it if you want a memorable experience of Rome and not fussy about luxories.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Sheida M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for five nights with my girlfriend in Oct 2011. I was very pleased with everything and I enjoyed my stay. The hotel is located in a great location since it's 2 min walk to Forum and 5 min walk to Trevi fountain and Colosseum. This area is very nice since its not too touristic and no busy roads or traffic and there are many nice shops, bars and restaurants around. The staff speak English and they are very friendly and helpful. My room was very clean and comfortable, and I loved the breakfast especially the coffee, fresh fruits and the local cheese and ham. I hope to return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: tuti13360
Reviews.Content: a lovely quaint hotel right in centre of rome, stayed in 5 bedroom suite, which was spotlessly clean and roomy enough for all. staff all lovely and very helpful, organised a wonderful birthday cake for my sons birthday. do not expect all mod cons and loads of areas to relax in this hotel, it is very small, but we found it perfect for our needs. my only note would be that it would of been nice to have satellite tv in english as well as italian for when we spent time resting in the hotel room. i would stay again and recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: Trifvic
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. Across the street from the Forum and down the street from the Colosseum and not far from other want to see sights. The hotel is small with friendly and very helpful staff. Surrounding neighborhood offered eating choices from small Italian grocery stores to sit-down restaurants. Everything we wanted for our vacation; it was hard to leave. Hotel Nerva will definitely be our hotel choice for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Well-priced central hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ianvt
Reviews.Content: Location: I was pleasantly surprised to find that it was about two minutes walking from the Forum, and going the other way yielded a small, cute Roman neighborhood with solid restaurants and good walking. Many places are reachable by walking, by it would be best to taxi at least one way to Trastevere to avoid sore feet. Staff: Excellent front desk service, very good breakfast. Although they could not allow us to check in early (flew in that morning), they happily allowed us to store our bags there while we walked around for the few hours before we could check in. Rooms: Not large, but very clean and very quiet. That's about all I ask for.

Reviews.Title: “The Hutchinsons”
Reviews.Author: Robert H
Reviews.Content: This was the first trip for my wife and I to Rome. This hotel is very convenient to everything. Our room was in the front. It was noisy because of all the traffic on this very small street. The rooms are small, but we didn't come to Rome to just stay in the hotel. For our purposes it was very adequate. The best part was the time Paolo spent with us providing advice, arranging tours, making dinner reservations. We were there during the protest march and aftermath of destruction. With his advice, we enjoyed that day away from the scene.

Reviews.Title: “VERY noisy”
Reviews.Author: rmcolin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Nerva for 3 nights in October, 2011. We looked for a hotel rated with at least 4 stars by TA, close to the main attractions, and daily rate lower than E150. Hotel Nerva does not deserve its rating in Trip Advisor, believe me. The rooms are small, old, and moldy. The room walls are thin and whenever the guest in the room beside mine used the sink or the toilette I heard a LOWD and unbearable noise. I complained about it to the reception but the management just shrugged and said that there was nothing wrong. The hotel is well located, close to the Coliseum, but Rome is a small city, you can walk from the Coliseum to Spanish steps in less than 15 minutes. Look for a better place if you don't want to wake up with in the middle of the night with a cardiac arrhythmia. Note also that the hotel is in a driving restricted zone. The hotel has only one permission a day to grant the guests. On my checkout, I asked for a permission in order to drive from Hertz to the Hotel to pick up my luggage - so I wouldn't have to carry them to Hertz office - but the hotel refused to grant me the permission because it was the day of my checkout. Breakfast is ok. Free Internet only in the lobby. The room safe is as old as Adrian's Temple. Air conditioning is central and depend on the reception's good will to be turned on.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at Hotel Nerva”
Reviews.Author: LadyTraveler92821
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Rome and could not have picked a better place to stay than Hotel Nerva. The owner was very helpful with restaurants to eat at, all were excellent and within our budget. Breakfast was fantastic and service was friendly. Rooms were clean and neat, bathrooms were small but once we got use to them were fine. The location of the hotel couldn't be better, it was centrally located to everything. We were able to walk everywhere. I highly recommend this quaint little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Located near top sites”
Reviews.Author: kim c
Reviews.Content: I am a retired, 72 year old, American who travelled recently to Italy. In October we stayed four nights at the Hotel Forum and one night at the Hotel Nerva. The two hotels are a few yards away. Both hotels have a great location, a helpful staff, comfortable European hotel rooms (smaller than most in the US at that price range) and are a reasonable value. Both were quiet, an important consideration for my wife and I, although that may not be true in the summer. The Nerva has been updated recently. Between the two I liked the Forum slightly better. Each morning we had a good, albeit cold, breakfast at the roof top restaurant. The view was superb and it was always a great way to start the day. However the Forum may look very dated to some US travelers while the Nerva is more modern.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely recomended!”
Reviews.Author: timo59
Reviews.Content: "" I stayed twice in Hotel Nerva, the location is perfect, near piazza di venezia and Colosseo, so u will have access to every where, the rooms r quiet,clean and modernly decorated, the breakfast is Buonissimo! , the staff r very friendly, i won't even doubt of going there , I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to enjoy Rome :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Aus_Harry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nerva for two nights during our stay in Rome in October 2011. From the Rome Terminal train station its an easy 20 minute walk. The hotel is easy to find, and located very close to the old Forum. While we were in Rome we walked to all the attractons including the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. The rom was clean and functional for our needs while exploring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Karo13
Reviews.Content: Great location, awesome staff very nice and helpful. Would definitely stay here again...highly recommend it. Great atmosphere and a family environment. Thank you Antonio, Paolo, Sally, and the rest of the staff for making our stay a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed stay”
Reviews.Author: dreamywalker
Reviews.Content: Well located for the Colloseum and ancient sites Short walk from the metro and easy to find. Small family run hotel, friendly helpful staff. Comfortable. Breakfast room very tiny so be early; was also the only public relaxing space and guests used it for reading, computing etc. Reasonably priced reastaurants nearby for evening meals. Felt safe and cared for and would stay again especially if travelling solo.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, great location, but a little rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: triceratops111
Reviews.Content: If you book online and take the discount for paying cash, Hotel Nerva is a good deal for the location -- at least for Rome. In the U.S. I'd expect more for the price. We stayed in two rooms -- a smaller one with a view right onto a wall of the Roman Forum -- pretty neat. We also spent one night in a triple room, which was spacious for two but possibly a bit small for three adults (the third small bed is up a couple of steps on a little platform, which creates a nice space for a kid, I'd imagine). The triple was around the corner from the main hotel -- you're buzzed in by the front desk. Others here have worried about the security of that, but I didn't feel threatened for a second. Neither room was particularly well-appointed, I'd say. Both had air conditioning that worked, but only after a call to the front desk to fix a tripped breaker somewhere in the building that prevented it from switching on occasionally. Bathrooms, as has been said elsewhere, are rather small, with a *very* small shower in our standard double room. What's weird is that the shower could have been fine, but it's built so that half of it is sort of raised up, as though designed for you to take a bath sitting down on one side. If you stand in one side or the other, there's not much room to move. Odd. The water pressure and heat were fine, though. Anyway, you are not paying for decor or showers at the Nerva, you're paying for location, and it's great. You are steps away from the Forum. Easy three-block or so walk to the Colosseum. Longer walks (warning, a bit hilly at times, but no problem for us) to the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Pizza Navona, and the great restaurants of the Monti area. There's a nearby metro station and two places to catch buses to the Vatican for a Euro per trip. The front desk staff was always helpful in directing us to these various places. They also called us cabs and made one dinner reservation for us, all with a smile. We also liked the little tucked-away shopping area down a narrow street around the corner. Cool little glass shops and the like. Decent breakfast, the Italian hotel standard, with bread, toast, croissants, meats, cheeses, juice, espresso or tea, yogurt and a nice wedge of custard cake. There's wifi in the lobby. They're happy to let you sit in there and check email, etc. It gets a bit crowded there in the morning as people check in and out of their rooms and have breakfast, but pleasant enough. NOTE: After our stay we were sent an email which provided a code for getting a further discount when booking online in the future -- good for us or our friends. So if you know someone who's recently stayed here, you might wanna ask them for that code.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what I expected”
Reviews.Author: hippichicknz
Reviews.Content: We booked a quad room for three people at around 230 euros per night. I guess Rome is expensive but I was surprised that our room was round the corner with no direct access to the hotel - so you are apartment style. If I had been alone I would have been concerned about security. We should have been told about this beforehand. The room was nice and we had a decent bathroom. When I left I had to drag my suitcase down the flight of stairs. In the hotel, there is a tiny dining room which doubles as a bar and the waiter kept whipping the chairs from one tiny table to another to fit people in, which was quite amusing. It is very convenient for the ancient sites but bear in mind you are then right in the tourist trap and it was always very busy. Personally if I visit Rome again I would try to find a hotel in a different area near a metro station as this hotel is very basic for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Linda P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It was very convenient to the Forum and Colossium. The staff was pleasant. I will say we had our choice of a room with a view or a bigger bathroom and without even looking we chose the room with a view. I would make a different choice if I had it to do over. The bathroom was very small and since it was very hot and we had the air conditioning on all the time, we never opened the window for the "view." Also, I believe they "turn off the AC" during the daytime hours which was odd. I found out because I had to return to the room, driven from the Forum with 100 degree heat, while the maids were cleaning a nearby room. They said I had to call down to the desk to have them turn on the AC. This seemed a bit odd.

Reviews.Title: “Location!!”
Reviews.Author: RadioMark
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in Rome at this hotel. As people have said before, the showers are the smallest I have ever seen in a hotel! Besides this, everything was fine. The room was large with plenty of cupboard space. The rest of the bathroom was OK. The breakfast was fine with plenty to eat but we could not make a good judgement as we were only there for the one night. It has free Wifi internet in the lobby but, as our room was just above it, it was no problem to make a connection from the room. The desk clerks were very helpful and they gave us a very useful map of Rome. The map actually made more sense than all the others we had from guide books etc. Of course, as mentioned by others, the location was exactly what we needed. With just one night in Rome we did a blitz tour of the city by ourselves so the 5 min walk to the Colossium and the even shorter walk to the Forum etc was perfect. It is also walking distance to the Trevi fountain and the Spanish steps. Just one thing, if you have luggage and decide to walk the relatively short distance from the Train station to the hotel....don't! The main streets are ok but the rest are cobbled and your luggage will have shaken itself to pieces by the time you get there. Rather use a taxi. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome. I would also have no hesitation staying in this hotel again if I am ever back in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: rjschmidt23
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome, and Hotel Nerva has to be the best located botique hotel in Rome. Situated directly behind the ruins, and a 3 minute walk to the Forum, the location is only complimented by the great service! Take advantage of the staff's local knowledge, and enjoy some of the incredible local restaurants within a few minute's walk. Since it's an older hotel, although they've done a GREAT remodel job, be prepared for smallish rooms, and a small shower. But then, who spends that much time in their room when in Rome?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: bigelskis
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to Colosseum and other attractions. The staff was pleasant and tried to be helpful, although one of them spoke no English, which made things a bit tricky. The room was clean, but it is the tinest room I've ever stayed in, with the smallest shower I've ever seen. If you weigh more than about 180 lbs you probably won't fit! Free wireless Internet was available in the lobby and some rooms (it worked in ours). We stayed three nights and the hotel was a good location for our Rome excursions. For the price it worked.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: carmarg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a five minute walk from the Colosseum and less to the Forum. The front door opens onto a wall of the Forum across the street. It's an easy 15-20 minute walk up to the Piazza del Popolo and the Borghese Gardens at the north end of the Old City. The front desk staff were chatty and friendly and most of all helpful - when they weren't sure which bus to take to a location they went online and printed out instructions for me. And all the staff - the servers in the dining room, the cleaners were friendly, courteous and helpful. I travelled in July so I appreciated coming back at night to a cool room. Yes, the bathroom was small. Who cares? The bathroom was also modern and pristine. It was a great convenience to have breakfast in the hotel - coffee, prosciutto, cheese, croissants and other breads, fruit, yogurt, cake. Booking online I got a great rate. I think the walk-in rate is pretty high. This was a lovely hotel and one of the highlights of my first trip to Rome. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest shower on earth”
Reviews.Author: N0rwegianman
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night. Thanks god I was alone, because of the sizes of the rooms. I had to go out of the bathroom to change my mind :) BUT: This hotel had a very fair price! I payed 90 euro for one night. The staff is VERY friendly, and the rooms are 100% clean. What more do you need when the location is 4 minutes walk from Colloseum?? I would definitely stay there again - If I am travelling alone. A girlfriend (At least not one of mine) would accept such a snall room for more then one night.... Another good point is that the hotel gave me a free parking approval ticket just outside the hotel. That's more than anyone can expect :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Marie C
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break to Rome. The hotel location is ideal - approx five minutes from the Colosseum and Forum. The staff were very friendly and helpful and our rooms (a triple and twin room) were very clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would not hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Staff could not be nicer!”
Reviews.Author: Eliza C
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels over the years and honestly cannot remember a place with kinder and more genuinely helpful staff. The front desk staff were always friendly and the staff cleaning the rooms and serving breakfast went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable and happy. They were so kind and hospitable! The setting was great, near sights and restaurants, and our rooms were quiet and clean. If we ever get to come back to Rome we will definitely choose the Hotel Nerva.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel, we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mom2edmd
Reviews.Content: After much research on Trip Advisor I decided on Hotel Nerva and I'm extremely glad I did! We just returned from a 3 night stay and it was really lovely! It's located on a side street overlooking the Imperial Forum. The hotel is very quaint, clean and everyone at the hotel is friendly and helpful. It is also in a perfect location for sightseeing. It's located in Ancient Rome and very walkable to all sights- although I'd suggest taking a cab to the Vatican. The room was very clean, beds comfortable and updated room. We are a family of four (2 adults and 2 children, 12 and 10). We shared a triple with an extra bed. Not alot of extra room but, very doable and I didn't feel restricted. Anyway, we were out most of the time exploring and spent our time in the room sleeping or a quick break during the day. My husband thought the shower a bit small but, definitely not a deal breaker. The breakfast was delicious and we later used the breakfast room to enjoy a drink and rest before going out at night. Overall, I would definitely recommend Hotel Nerva and would also stay again on my next trip to Rome! Thanks to everyone at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Genuinely warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: Beanbag79
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay in this hotel and the best thing about it by far is the wonderful staff. It is in a great location, just minutes from all the main attractions like the Spanish Steps, Colosseum and Trevi Fountain. It is also on a reasonably quiet side street so noise is not a huge issue. All the staff were very friendly from the outset. Breakfast is lovely, great coffee and bread, cheese and ham as well as fresh fruit and cake. The owner came down on our first morning and made conversation and offered us a paper to read. One of the young female staff really held court on the other mornings fussing round everybody and making us all feel really welcome. On our last morning, she gave us extra cake as we were leaving and actually thanked us for choosing the hotel to stay in. The decor is perhaps in need of some updating an the showers are out of the question if you are a big build but the rooms are very clean. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and would stay here agin in a heart beat. Thank you for a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and service”
Reviews.Author: gorfri
Reviews.Content: A small and friendly hotel with a brilliant location in the center of Rome. Just 500 meters from Colloseum and 15 minutes walk from Centralstation Termini and Pantheon at the opposite direction. The hospitality, location and the service in the reception are the three best things. The prices are fare and if you pay cash, you'll have a discount as well. Our room (103) was quite normal with two singlebeds combined as one double, one desk and a wardrobe. We also have a minibar, but as every other hotels with expensive drinks and food. Some negative things, a shower not built for a grown up over 170 cm and 70 kilo and also narrow when you have to do number one or two. Breakfast ok, but with only 12-14 seats you sometimes had to wait, not so funny. But.... we will return to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this little gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sweet_avalanche
Reviews.Content: Just back from Rome and stayed in Hotel Nerva. Absolutely wonderful location. We are a family of 5 and we stayed in a very large room with a double , 2 singles and a roll out bed was added for our youngest, at no extra cost. Breakfast was very nice, fresh fruit, hams cheeses, croissants, cake and fab coffee. Kids were offered wonderful hot chocolate! The location is amazing, literally 5 minutes from the Colloseum, and right next to the Forum. We walked to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain, its about 40 minutes, but lots to see on the way! The restaurants nearby were excellent and very reasonably priced. I think this is a far superior area to stay in than around the Spanish steps, which we had done before. Also, all of the staff we met were very helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderful breakfast, helpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: C Grell
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading Rick Steves' travel guide on Rome. We loved it! Across the street from Trajan's Market, 5 minutes from the Colosseum and metro, right in the heart of the ancient Rome district - perfect location! It is within walking distance of all major ruins. The optional breakfast was wonderful and well worth the price. Staff was very accommodating and helped us by recommending local restaurants and attractions, giving us tips on using public transportation, and directing us to the 24-hour pharmacy. Rooms were small (which is expected in Rome) but very clean and comfortable. The 24-hour front desk added a sense of security. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room; good value; excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travelsonitsstomach
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four. Italy hotels usually cram you in a tiny room with an even tinier bathroom. This hotel has a junior suite that is by European standards quite spacious. As we were in Italy during a heat wave--it was 38 celsius--we appreciated the air conditioning. The hotel is indeed in a wonderful location: out the front door is the Roman Forum. In 20 minutes walking, one can be at the Pantheon or Trevi Fountain; 10 to the Colosseum. The hotel gives a 9% discount if you can pay in cash: we paid 644 Euros for three nights plus the Rome occupancy tax of two euros per person per night. (We had breakfast one morning at the cost of 20 euros for the family included in this price). The negatives: my son was bitten by insects when we put his mattress on the carpet; the room allows smoking and therefore the chemicals they use to hide that smell are overwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Central Location for City Break”
Reviews.Author: AlanMasterton
Reviews.Content: We were surprised at just how central this small family run hotel is situated to the many main attractions of central Rome, Coliseum metro and the attraction itself are only 5 minutes walk, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps about 30-40 minutes depending on how many stops you make on route. The hotel staff are all extremely helpful and cannot do enough or you, lashings of the renowned friendly Italian hospitality. If we had any criticism it was the size of our room (202) which had the bare essentials but was to be honest slightly cramped but this did not spoil our 4 day trip at all, there was so much to see and do in Rome that we used the hotel as a base in which to sleep and change, although small the room is air conditioned, a must with temperatures at 38 for the ime we were there. There is a standard size lift in the hotel which is a great benefit on atrrival with your cases and the front desk is manned 24hrs. I would without hesitation use this hotel again but possibly ask for a larger room. Alan Masterton

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: mnbnyc
Reviews.Content: You can't find a better location than this. Step outside the door to the hotel and you are right in the Roman Forum, yet the hotel is quiet and small. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, the breakfast is ample and typically Italian. Rooms are basic, but very clean. There is a fast WiFi connection in the hotel front room. The prices are great. All in all - a great combination for what can be an expensive City!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: hittheroadgrammy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Nerva when we visited Rome this June. It is in the perfect location...right next to the Roman Forum, the Colosseum, and near the Metro. Also close to some good restaurants and gelato shops. The staff are friendly and very helpful with travel information. The rooms are small but adequate. One concern is the bathtub/shower which is small, hard to stand in, and get in and out of. It. could pose problems for people with mobility issues. We would go back to stay at the Nerva.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 4Family2011
Reviews.Content: Last hotel we stayed at on our two week to Italy. It was in a good location near ancient Rome. Our family of 4 stayed in the junior suite. It was clean and comfortable, but could use some updating, especially the carpet. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Antonio was kind enough to make dinner reservations for us and call for a limo to take us to the airport when we left. Breakfast was very good and served by the sweetest woman.

Reviews.Title: “My home in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: VagabondKVH
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Nerva several times over the past few years, the first in 2005 and I will always return to it. The Hotel is in the best possible location, you are on the forum and seconds from the colesseum and Vittorio Emmanuel, it is convenient to everything in Rome,yet on a quiet street that feels more private. The hotel itself is small, but has a great breakfast, free wifi( not common in europe) and a delightful, personal owner/ staff! They are always so kind and helpful and truly make you feel as if you are at home. I have recommended it to many and they have all said the same. I wouldn't stay any where else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Gem in great location”
Reviews.Author: torpedoDaisy07
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Nerva for 3 days in May. Room was very clean, staff was friendly, and the girls at breakfast were most helpful. Five minute walk to the Colliseum and metro. Would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with lovely friendly atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: RH10101
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. I had to change rooms on the second day as the bed was so uncomfortable for the first night. The staff were really helpful though and I swapped rooms without any problems. The hotel is basic...however, for all the time you spend in the room it doesn't really matter. It's clean and friendly and location wise it's cracking.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location & friendly atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: JeanYG
Reviews.Content: Went to Rome for business but arrived 2 days earlier so I could have some leisure time in central Rome to see the sights. Perfect location if you want to have the Colosseum and Roman Forum within close walking distance. In fact I walked everywhere, even to the Spanish steps and Trevi Fountain. Staff and owners were extremely friendly and very willing to help out and give advice. Paolo, one of the owners, saved me a huge amount of queuing time when he helped me buy my ticket to the Vatican Museum online.Thanks, Paolo!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: fyrecplnga
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night during a week stay in various cities in Europe. Ran by a very nice family. Everyone was nice. The bed was nice and firm for our backs after walking the rough but beautiful streets of Rome. Super clean rooms. Very close to Coliseum and the main street in Rome. Only one concern was the shower is a little small. Already have recommended to friends. Joe and Amber Atlanta

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, safe, clean, functional, in great location for ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: mgmh
Reviews.Content: The hotel was an excellent choice for a trip to Rome. Close to the ancient sites in central rome, clean functional room in another building. Quiet, roomy, beautiful bathroom. Clean, felt safe. Good breakfast served (as opposed to buffet). Helpful, friendly staff. A great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small everything except price”
Reviews.Author: 3girlsdogdad
Reviews.Content: Incredible location, right around corner from Forum and Colliseum but everything about it is small, from the breakfast room to the actual rooms and the showers. If you're not clausterphobic than you'll love this place. Staff was very friendly though I got two different answers as to which bus to take to get to the Vatican - the 2nd answer was correct. Wifi signal in our room was weak to non-existent - had to stand in hallway to get a strong enough signal.

Reviews.Title: “Warm friendly and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: upupaway219
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Italy. We stayed at the Hotel Nerva and it was just perfect for us. We travelled with an 8 and 13 year old and the quad room worked perfectly for the family. The loft gives the room alot of space. The kids took turns having the "upstairs" room to themselves. The staff was so friendly and helpful and the location cannot be beat. From our room you can see the forum and walking to all the Ancient Roman sites is easy. The room was clean, spacious and the beds were so comfortable. Breakfast was simple and the fresh cappuccino and expresso was divine! We walked so much, our feet were aching but our stomaches were happy! Viva Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Service was excellent in making arrangements for transportation, providing advice and directions.”
Reviews.Author: YaoYaoHonolulu
Reviews.Content: This family-run hotel provided a friendly, accommodating stay. Bathroom was small. Location was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is very very very nice!”
Reviews.Author: pponcioni
Reviews.Content: The staff is great and makes you fell very welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good value and excellent location - just right for us”
Reviews.Author: WilliamsFamilyUk
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I joined my husband on a business trip and we stayed in a triple room in the hotel annex for four nights. This is just around the corner from the main hotel and felt like staying in a real Roman apartment, ideally located for all the attractions in central Rome - we could walk almost everywhere and only needed to take a bus twice - back from the Vatican and out to the Catacombs of Saint Domitilla. The room was warm, comfortable and clean. The staff were helpful and smiling, particularly the breakfast ladies. The only things we would change would be to have an English news channel on the TV - there were hundreds of channels but no CNN, BBC World or even El Jazeera! In a week with lots going on in the world we felt a bit cut off. Also, wireless internet in the bedroom would have been good - there is free access in the small lounge but this meant a trip down the street and someone having to go with our teenage daughter each time she needed to catch up with her friends on Facebook (OK, perhaps we also looked at the BBC News site when she let us on her PC). This was OK for a short trip focused on sightseeing however. Altogether though, this was an excellent choice for us - nothing flashy but just what we needed for our short stay. My husband travels frequently to Rome on business and this hotel compares very favourably with much more expensive larger ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harris1962
Reviews.Content: This really was a great little hotel. Yes the rooms were small but as they say "Location Location Location". Staff were friendly and very helpful. We didn't use public transport once, everything is within walking distance. Try the Argentinian grill just around the corner, best steak ever!! 5* all inclusive's are great for the more exotic location but for a 5 day City Break this is a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great All-Around (Location, Price, Cleanliness)”
Reviews.Author: bingochips
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent choice and we would stay here again for sure. The location can't be beat — right next to Trajan's Forum and the Roman Forum. Very clean room and bathroom. Plain decor in rooms, but perfectly fine. Bathrooms were small with tiny showers, but we got used to this very quickly. Friendly staff. Breakfast was enjoyable — cappuccino or tea, assortment of breads, croissants, cheese and meat, fruit, juice and bit of pastry. Discount for cash payment. Free wifi in breakfast/lounge area. We stayed for a week and were thrilled with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Ancient Rome...”
Reviews.Author: DaisyHastings
Reviews.Content: When visiting Rome before we had seen the Nerva and knew we had to stay there - the location is amazing, right behind the Imperial Fora and next to our favourite restaurant, Mario's. Luckily, the hotel itself is also amazing. When we booked, we knew that we would be in the annexe round the corner (there was a small discount as there is no reception or wifi there), but it is like being in your own Roman apartment and you trot down to the hotel for breakfast. This review is therefore based on an annexe room and we cannot speak for rooms in the main building. We had booked a double room but (presumably as January is quiet) were upgraded to a room with one double and two twin beds. The bathroom was long and thin, but the shower (no bath) was double-size so plenty of room, with good toiletries and towels, plus a heated towel rail. Sadly, the hairdryer was one of those dreadful elephant trunk things that is about as powerful as an elderly asthmatic breathing on your hair, but a minor quibble for a four night stay. The room looked out onto a small rooftop courtyard and because it was up a side street off the remarkably busy road that the main hotel is on, was extremely quiet. There was the usual noise from the other residents (not just hotel guests but people who live in the rest of the building) - shoes on hard floors etc, but all perfectly bearable. We specified a non-smoking room (although it came with a ashtray) but the room over the hallway was obviously a smoking room and made the hall and stairs, and our own room, smell of smoke sometimes The bed (we only used the one!) was comfortable with spare pillows and blankets, and the curtains provided a good blackout. There were no drawers for clothes but plenty of hangers in the wardrobe so we just used the other beds as suitcase-rests. One negative point was that although the TV had some 200-odd channels, there was not one in English. Obviously we don't go to Rome and stay in our room watching TV all day, but just one English news channel would have been good... Breakfast, as mentioned, in the main building (so just hope it doesn't rain too hard as you run round) is in a small room with about 6 tables: not too bad at this time of year but we imagine there might be queueing in higher season. Coffee, tea or hot chocolate, and the expected bread, ham, cheese, crispbreads, cake, croissants and slices of fresh orange, melon and kiwi. The staff were all very friendly and spoke varying levels of English (our Italian needs improvement) and all in all, we hope to stay at the Nerva again and again. You are a 5 or 10 minute walk from the Colosseum, Forum and Vittoriano, and we walked up to the Villa Borghese which took about half an hour (depending on how distracted you are by the treasures of this wonderful city).

Reviews.Title: “History on the doorstep and Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: mrpsmith77
Reviews.Content: A smallish but friendly Hotel located on the edge of the ancient forums of Rome. With a small breakfast area but expect to go out for other meals - there's a good choice of eating places within a short walk. I found transport links quite good with a bus to the Central Station 100yds away and the Colloseum with its metro station 300yds.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, charming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LesTravellers
Reviews.Content: My wife, my 18 years old daughter and I spent 3 nights at this charming hotel. The hotel staff (and the manager) were all very professional, always eager to help and make sure we had a pleasant stay. The hotel is located at the center of ancient Rome, just in front of the Forum and 3 minutes walk from the coloseum. Most of the other attractions are also minutes away. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: weekendbreak1
Reviews.Content: great location, you could walk to all sights,although you can buy pass at airport for bus/tube which we did for 3 days,but as we said you can walk to all sights easily from nerva hotel,the only down side to the hotel we found,the dinning area is very small 6ish tables both mornings we went for breakfast we had to wait to be seated.we would recommend this hotel for the great location staff friendly and helpful. when out eating if you have option to choose and collect your meal yourself from counter do, or you will be charged for waiter service,extra 2 euros, little hiden extras add up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,clean,cheap so not 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: iagoapcoyne
Reviews.Content: 2nd trip to Rome so knew where to book,location is fantastic. You can end up in a building around the corner so state you want to stay in the main hotel with 24hr reception. We went in November so it was quiet, very small bar was souless. Same area used for breakfast (6 tables)so a short wait to be seated (be warned mind this was November) The shower was naff,smallest I have ever encountered so if you are over 5' 6" and 13st you will not fit in it -biggest let down really. Breakfast was basic and due to lack of room was all Non warm/hot food. If your the right size book room only -good value then as the 4 star next door is 165eurosprpn. Remember it's good points, it is clean,safe and very central!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, well maintained, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: aswessen
Reviews.Content: My husband, I and two friends stayed here during a business conference. Some of the walls are three & 400 hundred years old! A family owns the place, and an incredibly friendly staff will help you find restaurants, serve breakfast, or pour a glass of wine or espresso during the day. Pros: walking distance to any major attraction in Rome. Includes the standard fare of an Italian breakfast: ham, cheese, toast, coffee, juice, yogurt. The owner brought grapes in for breakfast from his own garden. A small bar is open during day to pour a glass of wine or make you a great espresso. Rooms were quiet and large enough. Beds ok, a bit hard for me but fine. I am a bit spoiled with Hilton beds but I slept fine and I liked that the drapes kept the room dark while sleeping. The room was quiet at night even though we were right on a street. Free wifi in the breakfast/bar area. The bathroom was fine, though the shower was sooo small if you drop the soap, ya sort of have to squat to get it..or do without the soap!. But rather than be annoyed, be charmed. I found it cute that the tiny shower was in a bathroom that had a sink, toiletries, hairdryer, a toilet and a bidet. It just seemed that over the many years and rebuilding, this particular room had a tiny shower. Worked fine though. The overall hotel has so much history with it, so be amazed, take some time and enjoy. The cost was nearly 300 euros so not cheap, and one has to weigh convenience with cost. We found great restaurants, amazing sites, friendly people and all we had to do was walk a few blocks. But you may need to go outside city limits to find a cheaper alternative. That all being said I recommend Hotel Nerva for a wonderful stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Clean but dated”
Reviews.Author: debbsp
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with my husband. The location was excellent within easy walking distance of all the main attractions and right on the Forum. The little street can get busy but it wasn't a problem. Very clean and the staff were pleasant. A particular thank you to the night receptionist who served us our Sambuca every night before retiring. Downside was the room was very small, but aren't they all in cities and the shower even smaller. The fittings were very dated and I don't mean antique, a bit grubby round the edges. Would stay there again though as the price, location and service was great. We discovered the first night that eating in Rome is expensive, 60 euros for two pizzas and the cheapest bottle of wine. The next night we walked over the bridge to the little street where all the italians eat and found a little restaurant in the first piazza which, on the outside, just looked like a cafeteria. It was heaving with a mixture of nationalities, lots of italians included. Two pizzas, litre of lovely red wine, coffees and sambucas 20 euros and it was buzzing. We went back every night. Would also recommend getting the bus out to the catacombes on the appian way. The bus is a euro each way (buy your tickets from the metro before, each ticket lasts 75 minutes) and the scenery and atmosphere is truely amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, hospitable, very helpful owners and staff.”
Reviews.Author: CaraB726
Reviews.Content: The highlight of this small hotel is the family owned staff who make you feel welcome and can't do enough for you. We have stayed at this hotel several times over the last 10 years. The only constructive comment I have is the rooms do need some "freshening up".

Reviews.Title: “make sure you're not switched to the building around the corner !”
Reviews.Author: gmtz10
Reviews.Content: Great small hotel, friendly, helpful staff, good location in historic area. Small but adequate rooms, however, washrooms and specially shower stalls are VERY small. We booked a room on two different dates, on the second date we were given a room on an isolated building around the corner, no front desk, no WiFi, no discount either!! Guests should definitely be informed that this may occur when making a reservation!!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Doc200
Reviews.Content: Great location, within walking distance of most of the main attractions in Rome, friendly and helpful staff, clean, decent value. We would definitely return to the Hotel Nerva.

Reviews.Title: “Location location AND service!”
Reviews.Author: Pruej
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location! Service was excellent and down to earth! Cost,comfortable and great value for money. I stayed only one night but would stay again. Also had a single room which was very small so if i stayed again and for longer on my own i would get a bigger room. Wireless service only available from lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the sights of Rome !”
Reviews.Author: westcoastboy
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, yet situated in a quiet side street just off the main road leading to the Colosseum, National Museum, Forum, 'hop on hop off ' buses - just perfect. Hotel is small but well appointed, staff friendly and helpful. We stayed in the annexe just up the street, room comfortable and bathroom was very clean, continental breakfast was fine. Plenty of restaurants and bars nearby on the main road, but seek out those up the little side streets - they're very good ! We were able to walk to Trevi Fountains, Spanish Steps but took the bus to the Vatican. This is amazing !! but just go in on your own instead of with a guided tour, you can wander and spend as much time as you want inside. Also the designer shops and boutiques are a must to see ( unless you can afford to buy ! )

Reviews.Title: “Our enitre experience at Hotel Nerva was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: iafrate4
Reviews.Content: From our check in to check out we were accomidated in every way...everyone was very friendly and so helpful with all our questions and requests. The hotel is convenient to all the sights and shopping. I would select Hotel Nerva again.

Reviews.Title: “Best position in town”
Reviews.Author: annge
Reviews.Content: Our 4 night stay was wonderful, enabling us to walk to all the tourist sites of Rome. The hotel has the best position in Rome and staff who are very willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: ashporta
Reviews.Content: Simple room in a great location with wonderful staff! Could not have expected a better hotel in Rome to meet our needs! You are practically in the Forum, and we walked easily everywhere, except the Vatican where we took the easily accessible metro. Would stay there again for a visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Just the ticket”
Reviews.Author: Philip186338
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to show our children the delights of Rome. This is a lovely little hotel, very friendly professional and courtious situated almost overlooking part of the Forum, a short walk form the Colosseum and Palatine and just a little further to the presidential buildings and thus the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. We had the added advantage of all being housed in one room, a rarity in itself, which gives a greater feeling of comfort and security for the kids and of course, helps with the economics of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellennt Service and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: rome40
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the centre of Rome and the staff is incredible friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay there .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Worlds_of_Wonder
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it was recommended by Rick Steve's. We were not disappointed. The location is great--10 minutes walk to the Colosseum, 15 minutes walk or so to the Victor Emmanuel II monument, and easy access to many of Rome's main streets. Romani Termini-the main train station in Rome--is close, too. The service at the hotel was quite good and the staff's English is solid. The breakfast area is small, but the breakfast is nice (more than some European lodgings) and the breakfast area serves as the wifi hotspot in the afternoon and evening, which makes it a good place to meet fellow travelers and share stories. Our room, designed for families, was pleasant, but in a building separate from the main building so I cannot comment on the quality, quietness, or amenities in the main building. There are many restaurants in the area with good selections and reasonable prices, lots of gelato shops, and many trinket sellers. You feel like part of the family in this hotel and be sure to chat with Mr. Umberto (sp?), the elder if he is around. He is a kick!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay...location, location, location AND wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: offtoseeit
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is a great place to stay as you enjoy your visit in Rome. Antonio, the owner, was extraordinarily kind; his Mom and Dad delightful, and the rest of the staff couldn't have been more helpful. Location is perfect. When you walk out the front door you will be almost touching the walls of the Forum of Augustus. We walked 2 blocks to the Colosseum!! Granted to walk to the Spanish Steps was 15 minutes, but an easy walk with such sights to see! Bus was one block away from the hotel and you can be anywhere in Rome!! Restaurants and shops right around the corner. Room with private bath was smaller than us Americans have in the states, but we found it to be very typical of Italian hotels. Very clean and comfy, but no view from our window. Who cares if you don't plan on spending your time there instead of out seeing the sights! Bathroom is small...but you ARE IN ITALY!! Actually, Antonio changed our room to what I think was the only room with a large bath...room 1. Thanks, Antonio! The delicious breakfast was just right, if you remember the fact that the Italians do not eat big eggs and bacon breakfasts. They offered quality and quantity. Lounge also had a bar and wifi that was available anytime. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting in Rome!! Antonio and family/staff, It was wonderful staying with you at the Hotel Nerva.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a great location. Rooms are adequate. Staff excellent”
Reviews.Author: taries
Reviews.Content: Staff is outstanding and very helpful. Rooms are small but adequate. Location is right next to The forum - excellent. Breakfast was very good. A very good value for this 3 star hotel, which is in the heart of ancient Rome. We had 2 rooms for less money than many hotels charge for one.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nodoughnut
Reviews.Content: The pictures of the exterior of the hotel show the firewall that separated the ancient Roman Forum from the rest of the city. The hotel is situated on a busy sidestreet literally a 1 minute walk to the forum and a 5 minute walk to the Colisseum. Staff were great, the father serving breakfast in the morning is a trip, a real character. Breakfast is included. Excellent cappuccino. Trevi Fountain about a 10 minute walk. The rooms are small but ample. Our first 2 nights the room we had reserved was not available and we were upgraded to a suite for no extra charge. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlohaYolanda
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nerva is in the heart of the ancient city and a great central place to say when visiting Rome walking distance to major transit. It's a small family run hotel with European size rooms, very clean and recently updated. Family staff was warm, friendly, excellent and very helpful and was great orientation to our time trip to Italy. Before the trip they responded promptly to my email questions and requests.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay at Hotel Nerva again”
Reviews.Author: tarkin
Reviews.Content: I booked a hotel room at Nerva online and when I arrived, the gentleman at reception was extremely apologetic and said that the online system wasn't caught up and the last room had been booked minutes before I booked mine. I thought to myself "great, another run around." But that wasn't the case at all. Paolo called around local hotels and booked me a room for one night so I could come back to Nerva the next night. He took care of the room and paid for a taxi to get there (only about a block away). He was extremely friendly and gracious. He said he would upgrade us the following night. The room he booked down the street was fantastic. The next morning, we went back to Nerva with our bags and Paolo took care of them until the room was free. When we finally got to the room, it was directly overlooking the Roman Forums. The room was pleasant and everything was perfect. The morning we had to leave, we had stayed out too late the night before, but Paolo insisted that we sit down for some free cornettas and cafes. It was delicious and a good boost. Paolo called a taxi for us and saw us off to the airport. I would say that this was perhaps the best service I've ever gotten at a hotel. Next time we're in Rome there is no question we'll stay at Hotel Nerva again. It is in a perfect location, just a minute or two from the Colosseum and the forums and other sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: riceysu
Reviews.Content: I'd gladly go back to this hotel again for my next trip to Rome - and highly recommend it to others too! While the rooms were indeed quite small, it was clean and comfortable. It was perfectly located - less than 10 minute walk to Piazza Venezia, the Colosseum and the Foro Romano and the staff were very friendly and gave helpful suggestions. The breakfast is pretty good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nerva assured my introduction to Italy was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: av1953
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nerva is a small property (owned? and) operated by a wonderful, friendly family. Beginning at check-in, you are treated as if you are one of the family. And it just continues to get better throughout your stay. Antonio, his sister Anna, and her husband Paola made certain we had maps and directions to each of our destinations. And of course they provided travel and dining tips that are privy only to the locals. They made certain we understood their directions before they would let us venture out into their great city of Roma. Antonio and Anna's parents also are part of the wonderful hospitality team. A nicer, happy, friendlier couple would be hard to find. And of course they too made us feel right at home in their hotel. The room was well appointed and should earn a solid 3 star rating. The reviews about the shower being tiny are true. When you first see it, you will wonder how it will be possible to shower in such a small enclosure. Let me assure you, it can be done! If it didn't have a detachable hand-held showerhead, it might be a different story though. The room was expertly cleaned each day and all linens and toiletries were replenished. The location of Hotel Nerva can't be beat. Directly across the street from the Forum. Walking distance to many of the major sights, Colosseum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, etc. Also just a few blocks from the subway and many major bus lines. Very convenient to the main train terminal. The reason I rated this hotel as an excellent value is not strictly economic. The value of the genuine, caring, friendly service by all the staff at the hotel cannot be overstated. They are the reason that I can wholeheartedly encourage you stay at this wonderful establishment. I worked in the hospitality industry for 35+ years and recognize this group of people as being very, very good at what they provide their clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but a shame that the room and bed was so small.”
Reviews.Author: TAF8
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent. The colloseum and palatine are on the doorstep and termini station is walkable (although it is just as easy to get the metro line B to the colloseo station). We were disappointed though with our room. The room was described as a 'small double room' with a 'french bed'. The room description was accurate as it certainly was small, our issue was that it was warm during our stay and the room quickly became like a sauna with two people staying in it. Furthermore, whilst the hotel states that the rooms have air-conditioning, this is as the discretion of the hotel rather than the guest. The 'french bed' was two small really to call the room a 'double' - 120cm. Noise from other rooms is also an issue - we could clearly hear the bbc news reports from the neighbouring room! Overall a bit of a disappointment considering the other guest reviews on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Astonished at the postive reviews for this hotel on Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: kamp54
Reviews.Content: Dark halls, dark carpeting, dark wallpaper, phonebooth size shower, three 25 watt light bulbs in room, insufficient light in bathroom to put on makeup, L-shaped room so small there wasn't enough room for me and my suitcase at the same time, narrow hallways. Frozen in time in the 1950s. The people across the hall showed me their room (a double) and it was about 10 sq.ft. bigger. Same 25 watt bulbs. Good location, decent breakfast, moderately comfortable bed, uncomfortable pillow. The worst hotel experience I have ever had in Rome since I first started going there in 1984. I left after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to recommend this to others”
Reviews.Author: k1w1brad
Reviews.Content: A nice well located hotel. Reception welcoming very friendly. Neat and tidy and very clean. We walked from Termini which was fine, some might find it a bit of a walk. At night times it was good to be able to venture out for a walk to photography the Roman Colosseum and the surrounds. Also in the other direction to Trevi Fountain. Actually it was so central that at night we walked and dined at many places without worrying about distance, taxi, bus or trains. More than happy to stay here again and will definitely be recommending this to others. Details on the website is pretty much spot on so no hidden surprises.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: italamico
Reviews.Content: It's tough to do better than the Nerva in Rome. It is in a premier location, right near the forum, but still quiet since on a side street. It is clean and the staff is very helpful and friendly. Bathrooms and bed quality are higher than what one finds in most Italian hotels, even expensive ones. The price is perhaps a bit higher than what a modest budget will allow, but you get a lot for your money. The first time I went was ten years ago, and I always try to go back when I'm in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, friendly staff, nice, cosy and clean”
Reviews.Author: Amadeus_LT
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my wife for a weekend. Some street noise (probably unavoidable anywhere in central locations). The blankets were a bit airtight, therefore, the sleep felt a bit sweaty at times. The TV had only Italian channels (a minor issue). Otherwise the room was good. Comfortable beds. Small but clean and convenient bathroom. The breakfast area was tiny (again, as in many other similar small hotels in Rome), but the staff was arranging everything smoothly so that you sit and don't have to get up, everything is served to your table. The breakfast was a bit frugal, limited choice but good quality. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Overall, we were pleased with our stay there and we do recommend Hotel Nerva. I mentioned the small issues here more for the hotel staff to read to help them bring their already very good hotel closer to perfection. Best regards to Antonio! Thank you! :-)

Reviews.Title: “great service great location”
Reviews.Author: cs479
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a small gem hidden behind the Forum. The service is excellent and friendly and the nearby attractions, cafes and restaurants made our stay in Rome wonderful. We will stay here again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: coup
Reviews.Content: Perfect location at the right price (see more below). When I booked this I did not fully appreciate that this is the place to be in Rome. Just a few steps from the door and you are in the heart of the Forum area with the Colisseum and Capitol right next to it. In fact the whole Forum area is more extensive than I expected, butting right up against the wall opposite the hotel. The effect is to make the whole city feel more open. Much preferable to a traffic filled street next to the station! Most other sights are within walking distance and when you do get tired a bus ride only costs one euro. The hotel itself is small but very friendly. Our room was not too small although the shower is famously cramped. Didn't bother a couple of seasoned caravanners! TV was a 19in LCD but only English channel is BBC World News. Breakfast is served at your table and is more than enough to set you up for the day. Pity that wi-fi is only available in the lobby but this was enough to save our trip when the volcanic ash cloud blew over. And so to price....We booked 3 months ahead and paid 124 euros a night just after the busy Easter week. This seems fair to me for a 3 star hotel in this location. However, the headline rate is over 230 euros which is quite rediculous. When our flight was cancelled and we needed to stay an extra 4 nights there was much umming and aahing before they eventually offered us the same room at 160 euros. A quick check on venere.com showed they were now booking at 234! However, it also showed the Hotel Forum Cavalieri just round the corner at 120. So we moved and had a bigger room and a buffet breakfast for the rest of our extended stay (see my review)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nerva takes great care of guests”
Reviews.Author: genlee33
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recommended by a friend and the other Tripadvisor recommendations sold me. The staff was wonderful in responding to e-mails, arranging an airport pickup, and providing useful directions and guidance. The room was a little small, but the beds were comfortable and everything was clean and tasteful. Would absolutely book again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and more than excellent hospitality”
Reviews.Author: LimburgKme
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the center , near Formum Romanum and Collosseum, near Trevi and Pantheon. Perfect place to start discovering the city of Rome. Very friendly and helpfull staff ! Specially the two ladies serving the breakfast !

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: grlantrn13
Reviews.Content: Old, cramped, weird stains on the wallpaper (at confusingly varying heights), and walls like cardboard. We fortunately only spent one night here. There was a large group of french high school girls staying there too, and the room immediately next to ours was filled with two who stayed up till 2 AM yelling and laughing. we could hear their every word and movement as if they were in our room. We called to complain twice, and to the hotel's credit, they did come up and tell the girls to be quiet both times, but it didn't matter. I was shocked at how clearly we could hear them. This hotel may have been charming in the early 80's, but it doesn't seem to have been spruced up since then. The safe was impractically small (wouldn't fit a small laptop or camera), and the room was tiny to match. The bed was actually comfortable enough, but when we asked for extra pillows, we were only given one and told that there were no more to give. I dont' think that two extra pillows is an unreasonable request. The location is probably the best thing, as it's literally a stone's throw from the Roman Forum. They have a breakfast room, but it appeared that everything cost money (no included breakfast). IT was WAY overpriced for what it was. I guess you're paying for the location, but there wasn't much more beyond that.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nerva has a wonderful, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: travelwiz8927
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just like we had anticipated. Even the son of the owners, Antonio ,helped serve breakfast plus he gave us the name of a fantastic restaurant. Great location. The shower was too small--only drawback.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific staff!”
Reviews.Author: cornflakes812
Reviews.Content: Picked Hotel Nerva from a Rick Steves' book, and it was a great choice. Location is perfect for ancient Rome walking and easy to get to center of town on foot, too. Our rooms were fine altho not luxurious (great heated towel racks, tho!). Wonderful breakfast each morning with staff remembering our coffee preferences. Paolo and Anna at the desk could not have been more helpful--excellent restaurant recommendations and ideas for what to see when. Helped us book tours and time slots at Borghese Galleries. We would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: Merblajam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. The hotel arranged for a car to pick us up at the airport and a tour guide for a fabulous walking tour of Ancient Rome. Very pleasant, helpful staff. Rooms were very clean. Great location. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, convenient location, tiny showers”
Reviews.Author: TripRad
Reviews.Content: A great value for the capital city of Rome. We were three adults (my parents and myself) and paid 145 euros a night. The location was great to explore the Forum, Colosseum and near to a metro station. The staff gave us excellent dinner recommendations each night. The last day we made the mistake of dining at the restaurant next door (Mario's) and while the food was O.K. they actually charged us 3 euros for olive oil-not a normal/standard practice. The only complaint would be the ridiculously small shower, if you are not a small person-turning around in it can be a challenge (don't drop the soap!) Other than that we enjoyed the stay, great breakfast and cappuccinos, excellent service and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Charming but small - fantastic breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: veille
Reviews.Content: I got a single room, which was extremely small to my American sensibilities, but I suspect that may be true of many hotels in big European cities. The bathroom was adequate except for the shower, which was so small I couldn't lift my foot to my knee to wash it! Nevertheless, the room was quiet, I felt secure as a young solo female traveler, the staff was kind and helpful, and the complimentary breakfast was superb. Really, the best hotel breakfast I've had, but then maybe I was charmed by the hotel's lobby and breakfast room atmosphere and therefore easily impressed. Jam, cheese, little toasts in packages, fruit - and you could have seconds! I did, everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: POP49
Reviews.Content: First trip to Europe. Room was neat, very comfortable, with firm beds. Small (european) shower. Very close to Colosseum, Forum and Wedding Cake. 5 minute walk to the Metro station at the colosseum. There was a lot of road noise, but since it was on a small street, the traffic ended around 10/11 PM. I slept very well. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: richp4nyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Nerva for 2 nights for a short family break in Rome. The hotel and rooms were clean and comfortable, and the staff were friendly. The continental breakfast was good although the breakfast room is quite small and I would imagine there could be seating problems if you were unlucky with timing. Fortunately we were OK both mornings. The hotel is situated next to the Forum and just a few minutes walk from the Coleseum. We also walked to all the obvious sights from the hotel (Trevi Fountain, Pantheon etc.) as well as to The Vatican - although that took about 40 minutes so it might be too much for some. There is a very friendly and good Italian restaurant (Mario's) just a few metres up the road from the hotel if you are looking for somewhere close to eat in the evening. The only things I would mention is that the type of taxi booked by the hotel to take us back to the airport was not subject to the flat fare arrangement they have in Rome for airport taxi trips. It was not a rip-off but was a bit more expensive. Overall we would definitely return to the Nerva when next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with wonderful hosts”
Reviews.Author: montenidosteve
Reviews.Content: We appreciate the hospitality extended to us by Anna, Paolo and Antonio. They made us feel at home, from serving us breakfasts and helping us find our way around town to providing excellent dining recommendations and arranging for our airport transportations. The hotel is in an excellent location, with easy (walking) access to all the top attractions of Rome, from the Forum and the Trevi Fountain to the Pantheon and Trastevere. (Yes, I did walk.) The room was small (by American standards) but clean and certainly adequate for us. My wife and I will definitely return for a future visit since we like the hosts very much and we love the location. My only request on our next trip will be for a larger shower. I understand from reading previous reviews is that there are roomier showers in the hotel other than those on the first floor. The one we had would have been fine except that the bathtub has two steps/levels in it and I slipped and fell while maneuvering around the narrow space. Fortunately, I was not hurt. However, working the shower would have been a challenge for an older person or a person much bigger than I. Other than the shower, the hotel would have been perfect and would merit a 5-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BristolDisneylover
Reviews.Content: We have only one complaint from the hotel during our stay and that was it was too hot. The heating in the room was fixed on 24 despite there being a thermostat which we turned down it never went cool. Apart from that our stay was fine, nice clean hotel, friendly, helpful staff, breakfast was a simple affair (butter seemed to be rationed!) We didn't rate it higher because we felt it was expensive for what it was. No tea and coffee facilities in the room but a hairdryer, tv, cheap mini bar and trouser press. It is literally a 3 min walk to collesso metro station (two stops from Termini) and 2 min walk to bus route which we used everyday. Our Tip: Don't let a taxi rip you off. On arrival we were being quoted 40 euro from Termini to the hotel by the non metered taxis. The hotel told us to pay no more than 15. The queue was long for the metered taxis but we ended up paying paid 11. The Hotel Forum next door is nice for a drink!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Excellent Location, Wonderful work-out for your legs!!”
Reviews.Author: Brandidale
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel based on the reviews on TripAdvisor, yet again, we were not disappointed. We were amazed at how close we were to the sights we came to see! The Coliseum literally 5 min. away! Awesome! The room we had was great, when we arrived at the hotel to check in, we were immediately told we were being changed to another room. We were moved to the attached apartment style rooms up the hill (hence the work-out mention :) ). Great room, though, Very roomy. Bathroom was large, bed was big, we controlled our air conditioner as we wished. Gentleman that checked us in was so very hilarious and friendly. Didnt have WI-FI in the room, but we knew that going in...we knew it was in lobby, just never made it there to use it. Front office staff spoke excellent English, was very helpful negotiating taxi to airport when we left and giving us directions and must-see places to go whilst we were there. Loved the hotel and location. Would defintely recommend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel at an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Visitorfromtheeast
Reviews.Content: The staffs are all very friendly and so kind as to respond to any request. I have known this hotel for nearly ten years and keep coming back. The location is excellent, within an easy-walking distance to ancient cites, including Colosseo. The cost is reasonable. Caveat: rooms are rather small (especially single-bedded room). The Internet is only available in the lobby (for free).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable, and clean, with courteous, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Likkle
Reviews.Content: We spent two weekend nights at Hotel Nerva. Our room was small, but clean and comfortable, with a good size bathroom and a back door that opened to the outside. We had adequate heat, hot water, a decent bed, etc. The room was spotless and we had daily maid service. Although our room was on the first floor just off the lobby/breakfast area, it was reasonably quiet. The breakfast included a little ham and cheese, as well as pastries, toast, etc., plus juice and espresso/coffee. The lobby/breakfast area was pleasant and the wifi access was reliable from there. The hotel location was convenient for seeing ancient ruins, accessing the metro, etc. The nearby streets felt safe and were not too noisy. There were restaurants nearby, too. When we arrived in Rome, we walked to the hotel from the main train station (takes about 20 minutes from there). The staff spoke English well and helped with directions, recommendations, printing boarding passes, etc. They were friendly and made us feel welcome. We relaxed there and made the most of our time in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Hotel Nerva”
Reviews.Author: linbo
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel could not be located in a better place - practically in the Roman Forum and around the corner from the Coliseum.
