Our hosts could not have been more gracious and helpful. Our room (303) was spacious and spotless. The continental breakfast was lovely and included outstanding cappuccino. Thank you Antonio, Paolo and Anna - when in Rome we wouldn't stay anywhere else. Bob and Linda Goldstein

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: pjxak
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a group of friends on second floor in early November. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The rooms are small and the shower stalls very very small, smallest I' ve stayed in in Rome, Europe, but maybe I was just lucky before. I think they were about 2 feet x 2 feet. My husband is 6 feet and a big guy. It was difficult but not impossible for him to take a shower. But we had a great time anyway. And as others have said, we didn't go to Rome to hang out in our rooms. We thank the management and the staff for making our stay memorable and especially for recommending dinner at Ristorante Fabrizio. Thanks Antonio!

Reviews.Title: “WOULD STAY THERE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: tomatopa2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 3 nights pre-cruise. It is in a great location. I am not a walked, but was able to walk to most locations.....Most of the staff was helpful...problems only with one..... The breakfast was nice and enough..... There was no internet in our room...had to go to the lobby....had thought there had computers to use...but they did not...must have your own. Had problem with elevator not working when it rained...some leakage problem. Did not care for the eatery up the street...about 10 steps....the waiter was very rude.....think Mario's was the name. Good value at Valentino's not far on the main street..... Rooms are small...but no problems...think we were in 204.....better bath than some. I did almost lose one suitcase the morning we were leaving for the ship....it got into a taxi with people going to the airport....I about paniced...or I did panic....they were able to call the cab driver and they turned around and brought it back.....thank goodness!!! we loved Roma and the Nerva. any questions about the hotel or Roma. please ask.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of average pricing for rooms”
Reviews.Author: naomineu1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NOT worth the money and the owners average out the cost of the rooms per night. Very Strange. Owners wife was rude when I questioned this system. When I asked for two blankets, the owner brought 2 ugly, mismatched striped and plaid blankets and was angry when I insisted that I get two of the same. Not nice. Not again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, but be aware!”
Reviews.Author: yogimo
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel with a good location, the Nerva is for you, but be aware of the following: 1) Rooms, at least the one that we stayed in, which according to the layout seemed average, are very small. Luggage has to be stored in front of the door. A large suitcase cannot be opened fully. On each side of the bed there is about 30 to 40 cm of space. 2) Bathroom is also very small, in the shower you cannot bend forward, your head will hit the wall 3) Everything looks very old and worn out Guess if the price was below EUR 50 / night it is acceptable, but not for nearly 200 EUR a night. Breakfast is OK, but not too much choice, a good continental style breakfast. Would I go there again, probably not, as I prefer a larger room, as you do not "just sleep" in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A charmer in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mark_SydNSW
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent for tourists – there are ancient Roman ruins on the other side of the street and the Colosseum and Pallantine Hill are nearby. It is also close to a Metro rail station (you can walk to the station, buy a ticket and be on the platform in 10 minutes) – this makes it easy to get to the Vatican Museums etc. Staff were pleasant and helpful and spoke English. They even laugh at bad jokes they must have heard a thousand times before. Be warned that the shower cubicle in the room is small, although this is the norm in Europe. Breakfast service was exceptional – as soon as you sit down plates of food are brought to your table (breakfast is included in the room tariff).

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location and Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: Susan1958
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tucked in behind the Imperial Forums (okay, Fora) and is within steps of some of the greatest sites of ancient Rome. Even better, its location on a small side street makes it unusually quiet for this noisy city. I recommend it for anyone, like me, who has trouble falling asleep to the sound of traffic. My room (7) was small, but comfortable. I had to go to the lobby to use the wireless internet because there is an intervening stone wall. I believe many of the rooms have wireless in the room, but mine did not. The staff was friendly and helpful. I was working while I was there and so had to spend several hours each day on my laptop in the breakfast room. They made me feel welcome, but left me alone except for occasionally offering to get me something. Very nice. My only quibble is that they turn the A/C off each day when the clean and you have to go to the front desk to ask them to turn it on again. I would suggest that they do this automatically during hot weather. Overall, I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location Location!!”
Reviews.Author: virgothoth
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in Hotel Nerva for 6 days (Oct 15 - 20th 2009..high ^5 to the other groups staying there =)~) and it was fantastic!! My wife and I had room 1 on the bottom floor while family including a 6yr old had a larger room with loft area on third floor. Our room was very nice in size and even had a backdoor to a very small outdoor garden area in the back. There was one other hotel room door that looked to have access to this small, private garden but I never saw a single person besides my wife and I out there throughout our whole stay. It was a great area to stretch out and rest the feet after a long day of sightseeing while enjoying a glass of wine without feeling like you were "stuck indoors" for the night. Was also nice to check the temp and sky in the morning so we had a better idea of what to wear without going through breakfast and lobby area to the outdoors. Sometimes we would bring a few lunches from all the nearby deli's and carry-outs from the near by restaurants into the garden for a great little private yet outdoor (very cozy Italian feel back there with the old buildings rising up all around you with classic looking vines hangin down and all..i really loved it!) picnic. It is Rome and it is in a GREAT LOCATION so we didn't spend too much time in the room/hotel with so much being so close by. Ruins all around you (as soon as you walk out hotel front door), Colosseum is walking distance to the left once you exit hotel and capital building, pantheon and Trevi fountain are to the right with heaps and heaps of ruins, shops and markets of all sorts very close. This was much more than a trip/vacation as we all went in honor of our grandmother we lost last year and the STAFF at the Nerva really helped to tie everything in together. The 2 lady's working the breakfast service were simply excellent!! My wife was running late one morning and the Filipino girl made a nice tray with whatever I wanted for her to eat in the room since she was still getting ready. Its the little things like that especially after being in a foreign land for 3 weeks (traveled other areas of Italy and Spain before Rome/Nerva stop) that really made things nice and easy going. The younger guy working the morning/noon shift always had my wife and I laughing even if it was a brief comment while we were walking to/from our room. Once we returned home and were in the midst of jet-lag and travel fatigue, before we could lay in our bed for the first time in 3 weeks my wife said, we really need to go back to Rome next year and be sure you book us back at Nerva...lol

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay in Rome at the Hotel Nerva”
Reviews.Author: tmanm2c
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nerva is a perfact location for sightseeing on foot in ancient Rome. We walked to the Spanish Steps, the Colosium, the forum, the Trevi Fountain to name just a few. We would definately stay there again. Our host Paolo and Anna made us feel at home and were always there to help us decide where to eat and where to go.

Reviews.Title: “Small and cramped rooms but excellent service and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: oisinCo_Mayo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nerva is in an ideal location situated in the heart of historic Rome. Our only complaint would be that most of the rooms are very small and the ensuites are somewhat cramped. Having said this, when we asked for a larger bedroom we were moved the following day as soon as it became available. Breakfasts proved to be limited and very little choice however the coffee was brewed to perfection and the service was exemplary. Paolo and all the Staff were always helpful, friendly and more than willing to give advice on reaching places of interest and moderately priced Roman restaurants. The standard of cleanliness throughout the hotel was second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable lodging, great value”
Reviews.Author: mkriegal
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nerva was our 3rd out of 4th hotel in our whirlwind tour of Europe. It was chosen based on trip advisor reviews, price, and location. Price was very important to us. We got a great deal. The location was absolutely wonderful. Right next to the forum wall. A lot of people are upset that the hotel has no view, but we quite liked our view of the wall, and the small road the hotel was on. The actual room was quite large for a hotel room in a european city. One of my biggest concerns was a/c as it was August in Rome. There was never a problem, the room was always an oasis from the outdoor heat. The actual room was a bit outdated, but very clean and very comfortable. It was great to come back to a comfortable bed after long days of touring, and painful feet. The staff was great help and very friendly. There was free wi-fi if you brought your own computer, and used it downstairs. I would definitely stay here again. One note, we were staying with friends, who got a room on the 1st floor that was smaller, but more importantly, had a minuscule shower. We were on the 2nd floor and had a nice large shower.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: ItalyHMTrip
Reviews.Content: Out of all the hotels we stayed at in Italy, this one disappointed us most. The room was very small and the bathroom had barely any room. The air conditioning is not controlled in the room, and the room was unbearably hot during the 90 degree weather. The staff was not helpful when we brought up the air conditioning. The family that runs the place did seem nice, though. The location was okay but not easy to find or navigate when you want to find places.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, don't plan to spend much time in the room.”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine_Grl8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in an excellent location, right next to the Roman Forum and Colosseum. The room was incredibly small, and bathroom one of the smallest I have ever seen. The walls are very thin, and you will hear all other visitors while in the room. If you are a light sleeper, I do not recommend this hotel. Breakfast was poor - I was given 4 grapes, one melon slice, and 2 very thin half slices of meat. There were only about a dozen seats in the room, so the staff pushed you out of your seat fast (and still hungry) - - my "fruit plate" was taken when I still had a grape left (!) (Hey I was only given 4 grapes!) The coffee, however, was fantastic. For a nite, it is certainly fine enough - it is in an excellent location and you can spend much time seeing all the beautiful sights.

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo!”
Reviews.Author: gvvp
Reviews.Content: We started our stay at Hotel Nerva with prompt professional reservations service via email and phone. They were very accommodating. The hotel is IN a forum, and we were there to see the ancient part of the city- perfect location. It's just far enough off the main road, so it was very quiet. Charming, kind hosts (the hotel staff behave more like hosts/hostesses than they do hotel staff.) The only mark down on the room was due to the bathroom for our room. Quite small, and with two steps in it - the tiny shower is on one level and the sink, bidet and toilet on another. It was ok for us, but if you have any mobility problems, be sure to discuss this with the hotel. Ours may have been the only room like this one. The breakfast room is very small - but it does contain a full bar. (Other hotels we stayed in had serve yourself instant coffee - I thought instant coffee machines would be a sin.) Hotel Nerva serves the real thing, made in front of you by a friendly barista. It was fun visiting with other guests. Great visit. Wish we had stayed there longer. Can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: SquiggerToronto
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. It's a small family run hotel. Perfect location in the heart of ancient Rome...literally steps from the Colosseum, the Forum, Palatine Hill. Step out of the front door and the old Roman back wall of Nerva's and Augustus' forums stares you in the face. Very friendly and helpful staff (Antonio, Paolo, Roberto and Anna). Nice continental breakfast served. Room was clean. The shower stall was tight/small but we made out alright...don't drop your soap. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to Italy”
Reviews.Author: Gingermegs55
Reviews.Content: In a quiet street right next to the forum and just around the corner from the Colosseum. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our first three days in Italy were just made perfect by staying at this "small" hotel in the middle of Rome. We walked everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: garndi
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay because you can walk to most ancient Roman sites. Metro and bus lines are easy walks also. Great restaurants and trattorias are very close by. Hotel is run by a nice, friendly family who go the extra step in directions, restaurant tips. Very nice Italian style breakfast served by this friendly family. Rooms are fairly small, but adequate. As reported in other reviews, the shower is really small and somewhat of a challenge - would not work for a very large or obese person. We adapted and laughed a lot about it. This small hotel's plusses are its location, friendly/helpful staff, and overall comparative value. We would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and great location in historic Rome”
Reviews.Author: PHOENIXVictoria
Reviews.Content: If you are interested in seeing the ruins of Imperial Rome, the Hotel Nerva has the perfect location. Very close to the Colosseum, the Roman Forum, and Capitoline Hill (for a great view of the Roman Forum and Palatine Hill), this small pleasant hotel is surprisingly very quiet and peaceful. Although my double (twin bed) room and bathroom were on the small side (but common in many European hotels), the location and the helpful, friendly service of the owner/managers and other staff members more than made up for it. The breakfasts were very good and the staff went out of their way to accommodate us when we left for an early morning tour of the Vatican by providing an early breakfast. As well as being close to the ruins of ancient Rome, the hotel is also within easy walking distance of the Pantheon, the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. I would definitely recommend this hotel as a convenient and pleasant hotel to stay in Rome. As an additional tip, I would highly recommend two nearby restaurants which were suggested by the hotel owners: La Taverna dei Fori Imperiali on Via Madonna dei Monti (which had some of the best food I had in Italy and with reasonable prices too) - on a side street near Hotel Nerva; and Birreria Pizzeria, also on Via Madonna, which had excellent, inexpensive pizzas (and with an outside terrace too).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Babyboomers
Reviews.Content: We were both delighted with this hotel. Clean, excellent location, very quiet room, very helpful and friendly staff, and the included breakfast also very good. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Rome. Only one suggestion - while we can adapt to a firm mattress, softer pillows would be a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Ibanker
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with friends and had a great experience. Antonio at the front desk took one look at me and my friends and knew we were there to party. He whipped out the map and started ticking off the multitude of nightlife options throughout the city. He was also quick to warn us of the frosty demeanor of the Italian female (something we had noted, much to our dismay, throughout our tour of Italy). Besides a fantastic staff, this hotel is well situated and air conditioned. For a good value in Rome, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION -- FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: JFed007
Reviews.Content: Great location 2 blocks away from the Coliseum and Forum. Ruins being worked on right across the street. Local area that's convenient for sightseeing and hanging at local restaurants away from the tourist crowd. In the heart of it all. Friendly staff and decent breakfast. Open 24 hours so no issue in getting back into the hotel at late hours. Very, very small room (single -- $110 US) but reasonable compared to other hotels in that area. Room had a musky smell to it but so did my other hotels in Italy. Was able to sleep with the windows open with no problem. I would stay here again as I really enjoyed the local neighborhood and convenience of being in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - the location is superb!”
Reviews.Author: Lupinfairy
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is wonderful. You can stand near the Forum and see the Coliseum, Trajan's Market and the hotel! Our room was very comfortable, it was clean and plenty roomy enough for 4 adults with a bed up on a mezzanine floor. Would have liked Internet in the room but you could get it in the lobby. Staff were so helpful and we really liked the restaurant which was 20 feet up the road from the hotel. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly family run hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LondonChantalB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the night before our Eastern Mediterranean cruise. It's a well run family hotel, and we had a quadruple room, everything was clean and tidy and the shower was spacious. Continental breakfast in the morning was adequate. The best thing about the hotel was the location, it was close to all the major attractions, the fora, trevi fountain, spanish steps and colisseum. The staff were helpful and recommended a lovely restaurant for dinner and also gave us very good directions to the centre of town. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great "Old Rome" Location”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoHat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our teenage son stayed here for four nights and had a wonderful time. The location is extremely close to the forum and the Coloseum and about a 20 minute walk to many other areas of Rome. The room was a bit small for the three of us, but more than adequate and the shower was a typical Italian mini shower. The breakfast was a typical Italian/Continental breakfast of coissant, some slices of salami and proscuitto, and fruit with an espresso or cappucino. Certainly worth the 10 Euros for the three of us. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location overlooking forum ruins.”
Reviews.Author: Saska2n
Reviews.Content: Great value, great location in ancient Rome. Walk to the Forum, Colloseo. This hotel is about a block from the tower Nero is reputed to have watched Rome burn from. Very friendly staff with a desire to make your stay as nice as possible. Rooms are clean, Our bath was small. This would be recommended for travellers who are value conscious.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality, Service, Location = Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: AC_NYC64
Reviews.Content: Not the easiest place to find (on a tight little street next to Mercanti) but once you get there your in a perfect location for exploring Rome. Near all but St. Peter's; the 64 bus is a short walk up the road on V. Nazionale, Tabacci store next to stop, bus will take you to direct to Vatican. Staff is wonderful and special thanks to Anna for her patience with my Italian (Speri di vedere voi ed il vostro marito in New York presto). Breakfast is more than adequate for your exploration of Roman sites. Rooms are fine (we booked 2 double rooms for 4 people) and have enough space to store your clothing, air conditioning works all too well which was a reprieve since we were coming up from Naples where it was unbearably HOT! Other standard fare including mini bar, tv w/ BBC and CNN Europa but most importantly, QUIET. Only down point I would have to say would be the size of shower stall, a little too small for my travel mate to move around in but he's of a lager size than me. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel and will be back again next time in the eternal city.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kathy2Home
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nerva is located near most ancient sites and a short taxi ride to sites such as the Vatican. Our room was quiet, clean and very comfortable. Our six day stay in Rome included all the not to miss sites of Rome which were easily accessible from our hotel. The owners Antonio, Anna and Paolo speak impeccable English and were exceptionally helpful and friendly. The Colosseum was just a short walk from our hotel as was the train station. We took a short walk to Trevi Fountain one day and then again another evening for a night view of the fountain with recommendations for a restaurant for dinner near the fountain. Anna, Paolo and Antonio were always helpful with directions and recommendations. We would definitely recommend this hotel and are looking forward to a time when we can return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel With Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: seashapes
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Nerva with three girlfriends. The location of the hotel is fantastic and an easy walk to all the sights. Our room was a little cosy with the four of us, but clean, comfortable and well priced. We experienced the smallest shower in the world, but it was a small price to pay for our great location and very friendly helpful staff. A very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “In the hearth of Rome, for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Pluto81London
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights with my friends in this hotel situated in the centre of Rome. The location is superb in a small street of the Ancient Rome at 5 min from the Colosseum and the Forum, the staff is super friendly always willing to give you advice on what see or where to go. The room was very clean, comfortable and quite, but more important the price of the room was unbelievable cheap considering the location and service offered. I strongly recommend this hotel to everyone that wants to have an amazing time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Rip-off for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryTravelerSF
Reviews.Content: The other reviewers of this hotel are easily satisfied, unless finding a triple room is impossible. We came to Rome at the end of our trip in Italy without a hotel reservation. We ended up not getting into our first choice, even though that hotel's website showed ample availability that morning. Sweaty and tired at 8pm on a Sunday night, we stumbled into Hotel Nerva after checking out a Frommer's review from 2003. For 149 euro per night we got a shoebox of a room with a bathroom that was literally no more than 3 feet wide and a shower-tub that was the size of a large sink. Worse, despite the front desk claiming to have WiFi, we were unable to get an internet connection. The breakfast food was good - a pleasant surprise, but the room into which we were crammed to eat it made us feel like packed sardines. Fortunately, after our dinner the first night, we stumbled upon the Hotel Forum (which was just down the street from Nerva) on our return back to Hotel Nerva. Hotel Forum offered us a far superior room and experience for just 160 euro per night. We checked out of Nerva the next morning. The front desk guy at Nerva (different from the guy who checked us in) hassled us about checking out "early" saying we had "booked" for two nights, when in fact we had just walked in the previous evening indicating that we needed a room for two nights. Bottom-line, if you want to stay near the forum, go to Hotel Forum.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Abingerlady
Reviews.Content: A good,small hotel in a very good location. Easy , free parking and an easy drive from the airport. The hotel did not pretend to be luxurious, but provided quiet comfortable rooms (high ceilings and huge windows ) ,with a quality bed although a slightly mean breakfast and a small but efficient shower . The proprieter and his staff were very helpful and friendly. We would normaly choose to stay in a higher star hotel in a city but chose this hotel on its straight forward , honest approach and location. We could walk easily to all the major historic sights but caught the local bus to The Vatican from two minutes up the road (as advised by the owner). We got the room we booked and what we expected. I wished that we had stayed a second night rather than rush down to Sorrento.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nerva was excellent”
Reviews.Author: travelwchild
Reviews.Content: Great location, and easy walking distance to all tourist sites. Our daughter is 9 yrs old and she walked everywhere, except to the Vatican. The beds were comfy, and the rooms were air conditioned and clean. Owners very pleasant. Breakfast was small, but okay. Great lattes. It was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel perfectly placed in ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: Curley_Furley
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nerva is indeed a very pleasant place to stay. I would say that there is no hotel in a better location. The hotel is located approximately 200 metres from the main road leading up to the Colosseum, the Forum and the Trajan Markets to name but a few of the sites. As it is down a small side road it is pretty quiet which is great as the area is absolutely packed during the day. One thing to note is that there is not actually a footpath outside of the Hotel and you have run a bit of a gauntlet for aobut 20 metres before you reach the safety of a pavement. That said both my 85 year old Grandmother and I survived! The staff at the Nerva Hotel were very pleasant and helpful. I have no complaints there. The staff speak good English and there was no language barriers. I travelled to Rome with my 85 year old Grandmother who doesn't enjoy stairs! The manager was very accomodating; having a ground floor room made available to her. The single rooms there are fairly Spartan but comfortable. There is a small television and a fair sized bed with an orthopaedic mattress which I found to be comfortable. The rooms are quite small but as I wasn't spending much time in the hotel it wasn't a problem. The included breakfast was very good. Italian croissants and coffee are the highlights. The hotel is very good value for money because of it's location. Had it not been so ideally placed I would have said it would been slightly expensive. There are two restaurants right around the corner from the hotel. The Alle Carratte pizzeria and La Taverna dei Fori Imperiali. Both serving delicious food for very reasonable prices, I wholeheartedly recommend both. All in all an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: JJtripblog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our stopovers in and out of Rome and it was a great location. We walked to most of the major sites and took the subway to the Vatican which was very convenient. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel close to the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: kristingene
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to the Colosseum and the Roman Forum/Palatine. It's not particularly centrally located but it's not a bad location either. It's a bit of a hike to the Spanish Steps (20 minutes walking), but Trevi Fountain is only 10 minutes away. If you're in good shape and don't mind walking, the location here would be fine because pretty much everything is walking distance. The rooms were small but clean. The "double" is like two single beds practically on top of one another but that's pretty much what I expected. The staff is amazing, especially Antonio. He answered all of our questions and didn't lose patience when we had like, a million questions before heading out. He also helped to book our reservation at the Borghese Gallery and book a cab to the train station. The breakfasts here are amazing. There is no shortage of coffee, ever. They had amazing croissants, fruit, pastries, and bread for breakfast so we always had the chance to get a good meal in before starting out the day. In general, I loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny treasure right next to the Forum”
Reviews.Author: SueBirk
Reviews.Content: We had a room overlooking the tiny street and facing a wall from the Forum. We could open our french doors to the outside world, but when we closed them, silence descended. Good glazing on the windows! The bath was tiny and the shower was a bit problematic for my tall husband. Breakfast was good-- the capuccinos are good here. Great location for the Coliseum and Forum, and not a bad walk to other areas, like the Pantheon and Spanish Steps. Took a bus to the Vatican. Good recommendations from the staff who were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We Love Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: Deb-NY-FL
Reviews.Content: We are a family with 2 children 9 and 15. We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Nerva. Their hospitality was very much appreciated. The breakfast was superb and the coffee exceptional. Breakfast consists of sugar coated croissants, cheese and meat, toast, bread, different cakes each day, fruit and delicious coffee. But try not to be late for breakfast. The loft room was very big which was not expected and we loved the view from the window of the street out front. You could see the forum in the distance. There was also a small window in the loft which looked out over the courtyard. The elevator is small but big enough for 2 people with luggage. We used the stairs to go to our room on the second floor the rest of the week. The room could hold 5 people. There were 2 single beds up in the loft and one small bed next to the queen bed in the main room. The bathroom was quite large with a tub and shower combined, sink, toilet and bidet. The street out front is narrow so be careful when you step out the door because they drive pretty fast and erratic in Rome. We heard no noise while sleeping and loved to open the glass doors and shutters in the morning for a breath of fresh air. There was an ashtray in the room but there was no odor in the room at all. The Wi-Fi worked in the breakfast area and on the first floor only. We were told only 4 computers could be on at the same time but we never had a problem the few times we needed it. There are plenty of places to eat 2 blocks away an ATM and souvenir shops too. The hotel made 2 dinner reservations for us and the rest of the week we ate at a corner outdoor restaurant which had great food or around Rome. Don’t forget to eat Gelato which is Italy’s ice cream but buy it from an indoor store not a street cart because I was told it tastes much better. We had no problems with pick pockets or homeless bothering us. Just always be aware of your surroundings. We walked to the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Trevi fountain, Forum and coliseum. Took a tour of the Vatican set up by the Hotel and it was a great tour. We took the Metro to Galleria Borghese and park. And don’t forget to set up an appointment to see the gallery if you are going. They only give you a 2 hour window to see the gallery. We also walked back from Castel Sant’ Angelo which was quite a distance but the streets were quite interesting. We took a horse and carriage ride from the Spanish steps to the coliseum one evening. They were also kind to us which made our stay in Rome that much better. The sites in Rome were incredible and we can not wait to go back again and stay in this breathtaking country. We would recommend Hotel Nerva and would stay there again. Our coins were tossed into the Trevi fountain!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nerva is excellent value... great friendly service, nice accomodations & best location!”
Reviews.Author: JIMason6965
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel Nerva in Rome. This 3-star hotel should be qualified as 4-star! We stayed in one of the "newly added rooms"... very nice, clean & spacious. Bathroom was a bit tight for space but typical for any European stay. The only problem we encountered was with the shower "water pressure" at times. Otherwise, every aspect of our stay was excellent! You must choose "room w/ breakfast". If you choose "room only" you are missing a treat! The breakfast was excellent... fresh fruit, sweet breads, meat/cheese and the best espresso or cafe' around! This is the typical European breakfast. The family members that own Hotel Nerva were very friendly and helpful at every turn. The location of this hotel is absolutely ideal... blocks from many major historical sights, all in good walking distance. Hotel Nerva is one of the best kept secrets in all of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: FLBirdlover
Reviews.Content: We also found this hotel using Rick Steves, and as his opinion was seconded by Trip Advisor reviews, decided to book it for 3 nights. Couldn't have been happier. The location is on a relatively quiet (for Rome) one-way side street right next to part of the Imperial Forum and only a few blocks from the Colosseum. Plenty of good restaurants nearby. Included breakfast was more than adequate and the cappuccino delicious. Anna, Paolo and Antonio were extremely helpful and speak excellent English. Rooms and baths not that small by European standards. Only negative is the size of the shower stall- miniscule. Hotel is very clean and totally charming. Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “You will appreciate this peaceful hotel and its great location.”
Reviews.Author: IloveitalyFlorida
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with Hotel Nerva. We were always greeted cheerfully by the staff and they were very helpful, showing us tourist attractions on the map, making coffee "American style," organizing our taxi to the airport and making us feel very welcome and at home. The rooms were small, but very comfortable and clean. Although the shower was also small, the water pressure and hot water were great. The windows are double paned and the shutters block out the light, so you can get a great night sleep here, even though it is in a noisy and high traffic area. The breakfast was also very good. We stayed here twice during our vacation, and loved it both times. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm”
Reviews.Author: jant53
Reviews.Content: This hotel is practically part of the ruins of the forum and a 5 minute walk to the Colloseum, the National Museum and Palatine Hill. The rooms are not large, but immaculate. Family operated by a wonderful, friendly and helpful family. Many restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location for seeing historic sights.”
Reviews.Author: AnnGreentravel
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. We received a warm and friendly welcome, and breakfast was delicious. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly staff, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: oo7car
Reviews.Content: would highly recommend it, very helpful staff, excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location, and helpful staff made our stay memorable.”
Reviews.Author: Freddynell
Reviews.Content: Our accommodations were comfortable and included an nice breakfast. The staff at the hotel (Anna, Paola and Antonio) were willing to help us locate specific sights beyond the routine. They were very helpful . Our room and bathroom were swiftly cleaned which gave us a chance to relax in the afternoon before going out again for more adventures. The shower is small, but we managed without a problem. The hotel staff's restaurant recommendations were excellent! The restaurant, Taverna del Fori Imperiali, is featured in the May 2009 issue of Food and Wine Magazine under "Best Bites Near the Sights". Would I stay at the Nerva again? In a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and a wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: MaximusStarhopper
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay somewhere close to the beautiful sights of Rome and found the Hotel Nerva to be perfect. The Roman Forum, the Colosseum, and the metro are just a short walk away. The neighborhood is quiet, yet right in the middle of everything. We traveled with our two young children and booked the triple room which could actually sleep up to 5 people. We found the room and the bathroom to be very spacious for the four of us and the view was incredible. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was great. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I Liked It”
Reviews.Author: bgray5267
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and found it perfectly located, comfortable, and the staff warm and professional. However, on my last night I was shocked to be able to hear the water running and the TV from another room because I thought the room was supposed to be soundproof.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific family-run place in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: gkrykewy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nerva for 8 nights in early March 2009 (cost was roughly 95 euros per night after a 5% cash discount [there's a PostItalia ATM right around the corner on busy Via Cavour where you can take out lots of cash at once]. Our double room was on the small side, but with a nice high ceiling (roughly 18x18x15ft). Breakfast was simple and generally the same every day, but with different dessert pastries each day. Service was excellent across the board. Room and hotel were clean and well-maintained. One odd thing was that there was a combo shower/bathtub in the bathroom, which was less than ideal for either - it was like a sit-down shower with a detachable shower-head, which meant that it was awkward to find a place to stand in the shower. This might have been unique to our room, and we dealt with it fine. We loved the tall, brand-new seeming shutters that opened onto the narrow stone street. Best of all, the old stone wall right across from our room was actually the rear fire-proof wall of the old Forum of Augustus and Temple of Mars Ultor! (visit the excellent Trajan's Forum Museum for a scale model of the forum complex, and walk around back to see the wall). The location was perhaps the best attribute of this hotel. It's literally dead-center amidst everything, and so we walked pretty much everywhere for our entire visit. Hotel Nerva was a key part of a wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but extremely small rooms, boiling hot at night (in March), no air con, very poor quality!”
Reviews.Author: Valentina_review
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in room number 2!!!! I don't really know where all the people that wrote nice reviews about this hotel stayed but I stayed 2 nights in room number 2 and I was not happy. I have been redirected to this hotel due to an overbooking situation at the B&B I was staying at and I wasn't pleased. The location is good but you need to close your eyes for everything else!! The breakfast is fair, nothing wow but nothig awful either, just fair. The room was small, there was a roll away bed (I assumed this from the wheels, the bed would move every time you would sit on it), there was a balcony from where you could enjoy the company of a boiler, some broken plastic furniture and some dirt. There were stains on the wood of wet/humidity. There were marks in the mirror. The hair dryer was very very dirty and dusty. The mini bar had fingers of dust. And, above all, I went there in March when the temperature outside was moderate but, still, inside at night it was boiling hot!! I could not sleep (and I usually sleep every where and in almost all conditions). The staff were friendly but I'm afraid it wasn't enough to get me through the experience. I will definitely not go back to the same hotel and surely will not recommend it to anyone. I will post some pictures soon as it seems like 1 picture can speak 1000 words sooo ... Avoid this hotel if you can! There is plenty of choice in the same area around the same price that if you are not left to the last minute will be available when you need it. No wonder this was still available from the evening to the following morning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: enrouteto
Reviews.Content: We were made to feel very welcome at Hotel Nerva. The location is great--history is right outside the door. We received several good dining recommendations, too. Should we have the good fortune to return to Rome, we would certainly want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: corsw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five lovely nights at the Hotel Nerva in Rome. It was an easy walk from the train station (all down hill!) and an even closer walk to many of the amazing sites in Rome. Antonio was adorable and extremely helpful. (He's the son!) He provided us with excellent restaurant suggestions, made the reservations for us. Be sure and go to both of his suggestions if you have the time. They are both excellent values, and the best food we ate in Rome, without the high tourist prices. He also highlighted the places to see in Rome, so of which we might have missed without his guidance. The rooms were clean, warm and cozy. For being in the middle of everything we didn't hear any street noise at all. Everything was within walking distance. Breakfast was hosted every morning by Antonio's father, Umberto. What a treat! While the breakfast is simple yet ample Umberto chats in just about every language to everyone in the small dining area. Italian ... of course. English ... you got it. A splash of French ... bien sur!. He sings, dances and generally puts a smile on your face to start your day. My husband and I would go back to the Hotel Nerva any time, and would indeed recommend it to anyone looking for a lovely family-run hotel that is clean, and an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Delicious Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Markus49
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at Hotel Nerva in February. Their off season rate was very reasonable. It was in walking distance of many of Rome's attractions and fairly close to the Metro. The staff was friendly and attentive to our needs, even helping me configure my laptop to take advantage of their free WiFi. Their breakfast was fantastic - cappuccinos, fruit, pastries, cheese, prosciutto, croissants and more. Bathroom was newly tiled and fairly spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hefferz
Reviews.Content: We had a really good stay here. The hotel is in a pretty good location, about 10mins walk from Colosseum, 15 mins from trevi fountain, 20mins from Spanish steps. It is situated on a very rustic, Roman looking street, with some roman ruins opposite, which adds to the nice feel of the hotel. The Staff were always friendly and helpful. The rooms are ok for a stay in the city, not huge or particularly luxurious but more than adequate. We had a big bathroom with a huge shower (room 1). We had a very good deal with the hotel, so value was fantastic, might have been a little less satisfied if it had cost the full whack. Although, Rome is quite expensive for Brits to visit at the moment. All in all, It is a very nice hotel, and i would consider returning there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Tina073
Reviews.Content: Great location. Staff extremely helpful . Rooms of a good standard and whilst on the small side not an issue that impacted on our stay. Would definately recommend .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: SheidaVancouver
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful experience at Hotel Nerva since it's in the BEST location in the city and its only 2 minutes away from the Forum and the Colosseum. I also loved the smaller streets around the hotel Nerva because you really get the feel of Roma and there are many great restaurants, little caffes and bars, small churches and fountains and very unique Italian boutiques. My room in the hotel was very clean, comfortable and very quite for staying in the center of the city. The staff are extra helpful and super friendly and they made the best cappuccinos with fresh croissant for the breakfast. Overall, I loved this hotel and for the price, I believe the quality is outstanding and next time I go back I would definitely want to stay here. Hotel Nerva made my trip very special in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: toniaUk
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 4 friends having one night in Rome and we could not have choosen a more friendly, convenient hotel. We booked the room for 4 people so we could chat and it was plenty large enough. The hotel was just a couple of minutes from the Colosseum and Forum which was great. We also walked from the vatican to the pantheon to the trevi fountain. We did not feel we needed to use any form of public transport as nothing was too far away. The friendliness whenever we came into the hotel was the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: shyshez
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time at the Hotel Nerva. As I was only in Rome for 2 nights I wanted it to be a taste of the "real" Rome not some generic hotel experience. Hotel Nerva provided me with a basic comfortable single room with all facilities- shower and toilet, safe, tv, bar fridge. My room was serviced daily. A simple European breakfast was included. The staff were friendly, efficient and incredibly helpful. The location was in a little side street that was right next to some ancient ruins!! There were shops, restaurants, banks all within a short stroll of the hotel. Many of the major attractions were close by for people to explore at leisure. Unfortunately I booked tours to maximise what I saw in the one full day I was there so I didn't have time to explore as much as I would have liked. Whilst this hotel may not be luxurious it met all of my criteria - comfortable, safe, friendly, and very reasonable for inner city Rome at 80 euros a night for my single room including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mpit935
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Nerva. The location was EXCELLENT! It was close to everything but was on a quiet side street so it wasn't noisy. The staff at this hotel was extremely helpful and accomodating. They spoke English well and were able to help with us directions, recommendations, and booking tours. The inside of the hotel was beautiful, with gorgeous winding marble stairs. The room we stayed in was very clean and comfortable, with all the necessary amenities. It was small, but all hotel rooms in Rome are pretty small! We didn't spend much time in the room so it wasn't an issue. Also, the breakfast provided by Hotel Nerva was great!! Maryland, USA

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jman5112
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Nerva for 5 nights in November with my sister. We had a lovely stay.The hotel was nicely located near the Forum but put on a good pair of comfortable walking shoes. You do have to trek out a little to some sites but it's a beautiful walk. Everyone at the hotel was very helpful. They made dinner reservations for us and recommended places to eat. It's a lovely family owned hotel which makes you feel like you know someone in Rome. For the money and location, you're getting a fair price (even better with the strengthening dollar) for a hotel in Rome. There's a nice simple breakfast served in the morning but make sure you get there early enough or you'll be softly scolded by "dad". Highly recommend it. Thanks Hotel Nerva for making our stay in Rome enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly 3 star near ancient Roman sights”
Reviews.Author: leisurist
Reviews.Content: Friendly, family-run 3 star hotel near Colosseum, Forum, other ancient sights. The rooms were clean and updated, no noise problems. Under US$300 per night. The staff was helpful,gave recommendations for restaurants and travel options. The guests were a mix of Europeans & Americans. It was a very satisfactory stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved Hotel Nerva!”
Reviews.Author: magmagirl
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel. The best part about it was the incredible service and amazing cappucino! Paulo, Antonio, and Hannah were so nice, helpful, and just went way beyond the call of duty...that is what makes the hotel so special.It is in a terrific location. The accomodations are very clean, though a little on the small side, but that is Europe. However, for the price and the spectacular service, you absolutely cannot beat it. Be wary as there is no sidewalk in front of the hotel, and the cars whizzing by can be a little scary, but once you figure out to walk way on the side you are ok. Hotel Nerva helped make our experience in Rome so wonderful. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: The_Trolls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Nerva from the 18 - 21 Nov '08 and had a fab time. My husband and I booked a last min city break via Laterooms and got a good deal. We checked the reviews on Trip Advisor and they were all excellent. We would add to these. The hotel is central and is very near the Colosseum and many other cnetral sites. For those that were further away, Paulo and Antonio were extremely helpful in arranging taxis and explaining to us how to get to places. We asked for a quiet room which we got. The rooms are spotlessly clean, simply furnished and an adequate size. 2 comments about the bathroom: it was again spotless, and the shower was rather small. However, for what we paid we felt we got excellent value for money. The hotel is family run and they are extremely welcoming, friendly and helpful. Breakfast is served to you and consists of freshly made coffees, juice, croissant, breads, meat and cheese. We had a lovely stay at the Nerva and would definitley return.

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Pburgtraveler
Reviews.Content: What a visit! First trip to Rome and celebrating our 25th aniversay. Anna and Alberto mae our vist so enjoyable. They fixed a special breakfast for us since we arrive late and tired What great and caring people. Our USA hotel could learn from Anna. The room wassmall but us Americans are spoiled. Great safe location. Easy to get to Metro. As we left, the misses was tearing up, but a huge hug from Alberto made it better. What a family-they really do care about their guests. We would return to Hotel Nerva without a second thougt. THANK You Hotel Nerva.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the Nerva”
Reviews.Author: MapleBridge
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent - right next to the Forum, staff helpful and rooms very comfortable. We stayed for a week initially and then returned over night to catch a flight from Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nerva - Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Ron3750
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived to a warm welcome at Hotel Nerva that set the tone for our entire 5 night stay. We had bussed in from Sorrento and arrived at the hotel at 11 am, expecting we would need to ask to leave our luggage until the room was ready. Happily our room was already available, so we checked in and freshened up before we began our explorations of Rome. Hotel Nerva could not be better situated. Our room faced the street, with double door-sized windows that opened to overlook the Roman Forum. The Colosseum and Palatine Hill are just a couple blocks away. The Pantheon is a 15 minute walk. Most all the ruins in central Rome are within walking distance of the hotel, as are Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, and many museums and galleries and good shopping areas. Our room was a good size, very clean, and nicely appointed. A room safe was provided, as well as a minibar with reasonably priced items. The bathroom was very tight in this unit - the towel warmer projected out from the wall and got me a number of times. The plus was that there was a bathtub - could do a little soaking to get rid of sore muscles after walking the city for hours. Toiletries provided were very nice and maid service was excellent. Breakfast was good - very adequate. I cannot eat dairy products, so my wife would take the cheese and I would take the meats. Breakfast included good made-on-the-spot caffes, yoghurt, a fruit plate, meat and cheese plate, a piece of cake for each person, small grilled cheese and meat sandwiches, toast, and cornettos. Certainly plenty of food to give energy for the day's explorations. The best thing about Hotel Nerva is its staff. The entire staff, mainly family members, were as friendly and helpful as any staff I have found. We were always warmly greeted. Restaurant recommendations were great (and there are many within very close proximity). The desk clerk happily called to make reservations for us. They provided excellent information about sites and shopping. I had neglected to make reservations for Galleria Borghese and the desk clerk called and made them for us. (I must say that Galleria Borghese is a must see.) Every interaction with the staff was warm and enjoyable, making us feel like very welcome and appreciated guests. We chose this hotel based on Rich Steves' recommendation - he was so right on this one. Good rates were given for mentioning Rick Steves and a discount was given for paying in cash. When we return to Rome, we will definitely choose Hotel Nerva again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel in Ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: NorthBeachTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I sent four nights at the Hotel Nerva and were on the whole very happy with our choice. The location was unbeatable -- we were squired around town by a good friend who was a Rome native (who lived nearby), and he agreed that we couldn't have been in a better location. We walked everywhere. The room was very nice (good facilities and quiet). The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful (and quite charming - it's a family run operation). My only suggestion for improvement is that they should make their rate structure clear at the time of booking, which they did not. The email confirmation I received quoted a rate of 180 Euros per night. When we arrived they informed us that rate only applied if we paid cash; otherwise the rate was 200 Euros per night. This didn't present a problem for us, but I could see how it would be aggravating for a customer who hadn't planned on coming up with that much cash. They should make their rate structure clear up front. Other than that, we had a grand time and would certainly recommended this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel & staff in my trip”
Reviews.Author: rometrip2008
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Europe, but my family have stayed before in Hotel Nerva, the experience was very nice, the hotel is beautiful, the rooms are very comftrable and clean and the staff is very friendly, we enjoyed very much our stay in Rome beacuse the Hotel is very well located and with a spectacular view of the Forum. Thanks again to Amelio, his wife, Anna, Antonio & the staff of hotel Nerva for another wonferful trip in Europe! Greetings, The Luque family

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: MollieBristol
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Nerva. Very clean, excellent breakfast and very friendly and helpful staff. Central location within walking distance of most of the sights. I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific experience”
Reviews.Author: 2aztravelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I most recently returned from a trip to Rome, Florence, Siena and Venice and we loved it! Our trip started in Rome and upon arrival we had a wonderful welcome at the hotel. The accommodations were very nice. The rooms were cozy and very clean and our bathroom was sparkling and seemingly new. The showers throughout our hotels in Italy were small (enough room for average size person). We returned from our daily activities to find our rooms cleaned with beds made and fresh towels every day. We typically did not hear anyone in the rooms surrounding us but the rooms are very close and with the windows open, you can hear conversations next to you. Anna, Paolo and Antonio, as as all the others we met, were extremely helpful. While we had some ideas of what we wanted to do, nothing had been finalized until we arrived at the hotel. The hotel staff did everything possible to help us arrange our daily activities. Our morning breakfast was very nice. The location of the hotel was perfect and almost everything was within walking distance. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice, comfortable, friendly and convenient location. The hotel staff was wonderful! We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful family-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: gaoyinglan
Reviews.Content: A great family-run hotel tucked away on a quiet street right beside the Forum and within easy walking distance of most major tourist attractions. Room was spacious and comfortable, and a generous continental breakfast (including cappuccino) is included. Above all, the owners are delightful - always so pleasant and very helpful with anything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nerva”
Reviews.Author: hunter122950
Reviews.Content: Great location behind forum, easy walk to everything we wanted to see or do, staff very friendly and helpful, and the quad we rented (two children 10 and 14) around the block from the hotel in another building was small but quit, air conditioned, and nicely appointed. I would definitely stay at the hotel Nerva again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Nerva”
Reviews.Author: Justgotbacknow
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Nerva through Rick Steves' guidebook. It is located about 2 blocks from the Colosseum and the Colosseum Metro stop making it an ideal location. It is on a very quiet back street that isolates you from the city at night, but it is right where you want to be during the day. The staff is very friendly and helpful and they speak great English. Breakfast feels as though you are eating with the family. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “adequate”
Reviews.Author: Milwaukee_WITimt
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, location was great, breakfast was good. The room was very small. We had a triple for two people and there was very little extra space. The shower was so small I could barely turn around. Air conditioning was not sufficient to adequately cool the room. Next time, I'd try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “hotel nerva”
Reviews.Author: farmerCornwall
Reviews.Content: very friendly and helpful, excellent breakfast. Ideal location as a few minutes from the colosseum. Rooms a little small but very clean. Staff very kind and polite and recommended us a good restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent people”
Reviews.Author: mutron
Reviews.Content: Well, I consider myself a strict and not generous person, but this people at the hotel were considerable kind with any question I had. Room and facilities can be consider as Average, but definetely they add many scores on service attention. So, the final score is Excellent, from my point of view. Thanks for everything. Ciao and hope to c u again. Dante

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, clean rooms, very kind and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Papyrus_8
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nerva is in a fantastic location-- on a small and quiet street that is within easy walking distance from the Coliseum, Forum, Piazza Venezia, Termini train station, good shopping and restaurants. (The Forum is practically outside the front door). The hotel is small but quite charming. The staff are very gracious and helpful. We stayed at Hotel Nerva twice (at the beginning and end of our Italy trip), and would definitely stay here again. Some of the rooms are small (and the bathrooms are quite small), but very clean. Great cappucino; modest but tasty breakfast. Excellent value, considering cost and quality .

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nerva a Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: lindabuz
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Italy and finding a hotel was daunting to say the least. We found this hotel through a popular travel booklet and contacted them via email. The allure was that it was in the middle of the ancient Roman ruins and a very short walk to the Colosseum and Palatine Hill. In fact, a majority of Rome's attractions are walkable from this hotel. The intimacy of the hotel was a welcoming addition after the chaotic hustle and bustle of a day in Rome. We had a clean and airy room with a big double bed (by Italian standards) and a single, with plenty of room to move around. The staff was very accommodating, knowledgeable of tourist sites and was available around the clock. The complimentary breakfast was delicious and their coffee one of the best in Rome! We were thrilled to have such memorable experience for our initial trip to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: choochoo_traveller
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at Hotel Nerva. It was a short walk (maybe 15 minutes) from the train station, and easy to find. It was neat seeing all the Roman ruins right across the street from the hotel. The Colloseum and Forum are also very closeby (~10 minute easy walk), so it was easy to come back to the hotel for a little break in between sight seeing. The room was not large but adequate, the air conditioning was great , though the shower is a bit tiny. One night were were awakened by a car alarm, but overall it was pretty quiet. Breakfast was nice -- meat, cheese, cornetto, toast and jam, juice, caffe/tea. Hotel personnel were all very professional and friendly. I had no problem arranging a room via email, and they were helpful with taxi and restaurant info once we were there. Overall, we were very pleased with our choice. The hotel provided a clean, quiet oasis right in the center of all the sightseeing we could want.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Eamonireland
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our stay here, very clean, reasonably priced and great location. Most of the staff were very helpful and pleasant. Will stay here again on my next trip to Rome. Couldn't be any nearer to the centre of town. Would recommend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awesome cappuccino”
Reviews.Author: monkeyGainesville_VA
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay if you want to be within walking distance of the Colosseum and the Roman Forum. Our double room was very clean and neat and the breakfasts(included with the room) were really good! We loved the fact that we really were within walking distance of so many of the major sites, everyone who worked there was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, family run in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DaveH-ExPat
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nerva is a small, traditional hotel located in a quiet area across the boulevard from the Roman Forum and about four blocks from the Coliseum. It is within six block walking distance of the subway, and an ideal location at great value for the cost for exploring Rome. We took the bus and subway in from the airport: it's good to have a map printed so that you can find the street: it's a bit hidden down a quiet side street. The desk staff is friendly and informative: there is a small elevator to the upper rooms,but steps along the hallways. The rooms are clean and comfortable, but simple and modestly sized: the beds took much of the space. There is a TV and minibar, a safe is in the closet. The bathroom is clean and functional; the shower is tiny but has abundant water. There is a sitting area with free wireless internet access located next to the front desk: the innkeepers have a bar for drinks on request, and evening spent there catching up on email and watching football were very nice. Breakfast is served in the morning: fruit, rolls, a selection of meats and cheeses, juice and coffee. It's a good time to mingle with other guests and to get tips for the day's touring (one woman suggested a shortcut from the vatican museum to the sanctuary that was invaluable). The desk staff is very helpful in suggesting local restaurants: two that were very good nearby are the "alle Carrette" for truly excellent pizza and "Taverna Romana" for a real local experience with fantastic italian food. We rented scooters neaby from RentScotter that really made for a fun day at little cost. This is a traditional family inn that will make you feel very welcome and that has great tips and wonderful location for touring the old ruins. Rooms are modest, but the public areas are delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vist to Hotel Nerva”
Reviews.Author: Beach4all
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the marvelous experience of visiting Rome, Italy in May and stayed at Hotel Nerva. What a grand time we had. The hotel staff was the absolute best. Very warm and friendly, family-run hotel. It is in a great location to everything in ancient Rome and easy to get just about anywhere. The rooms were clean, quiet and very well staffed. The bathroom shower is a tiny bit small but very workable. Their morning breakfast was absolutely wonderful. Always more food than we needed and the coffee - to die for!!! Anna is precious and Antonio and Paola were so gracious. We were going on a cruise afterwards and they helped us get to the port and everything. When we return to Rome and, I pray we will, we are so relieved to know we have such a lovely and special place to stay. Thank you all at Hotel Nerva. William and Elizabeth Brown, Pensacola, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nerva - great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JNGGY
Reviews.Content: We got the name of the Hotel Nerva from Rick Steves Italy guidebook. It is a wonderful little hotel in a great location (next to Trajan's market) and very close to the Colosseum and Forum. It is an easy walk to the Pantheon, Victor Emmanuel monument, etc. The room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. We had excellent (included) breakfasts in the AM and the staff (owner, daughter, son and son-in-law were extremely friendly and helpful - spoke fluent English. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location for history buffs”
Reviews.Author: GoObamaSanPancrazio
Reviews.Content: We come to Rome often and stay at the Hotel Nerva every time. We are history buffs and the Nerva is directly behind the wall of the Forum of Augustus. It is an easy walk to the Pantheon, Campo de' Fiori, Trevi Fountain, etc. The family that owns it treats us like family. The rooms are very nicely appointed. We will look forward to staying there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “The "Nerva" Center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Fishtrader
Reviews.Content: This is one of the Loveliest Hotels I have stayed in around the world. It is owned and Run by a young Brother and Sister partnership who immediately make you feel as if you have entered a private residence with the warmth and hospitality as if you were part of the family. The rooms have everything you need for the price and to be so close to the Nerve center of Rome it is very special. I strongly recommend you try them first if you have the chance to visit Rome. I cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid”
Reviews.Author: koutsoftides
Reviews.Content: With a smile you can win the world.Antonio,Anna and Paolo always smile,they are friendly and extremely helpful and the best they give you a kiss while saying farewell. See you next time we come to visit your beautiful city. Costas and Yioula Koutsoftides
